name: Romantic 2 bedroom private suite
description: The unit is a 2 bedroom suite sectioned off from the rest of the house with a private hallway door. It is not the whole house. The 2 bedrooms share a private full bath & shower. The property is rural supplied by a 150m deep well. Good water conservation practices are encouraged. The water from the tap is like your own Perrier/San Pellagrino spring! A 5th person can be accommodated on a full length floor air mattress, complete with linens and a pillow,. but it is best suited for a child.
host_about: Well traveled, experienced host, executive chef, dedicated to making your stay memorable!

name: Eagles Nest Oceanfront Galiano West Coast Home
description: Feel at home in an exquisite artist home. There are rooms for everybody to enjoy the generosity of  nature by which we are surrounded.  Explore our many trails and find many spots of great beauty, use the herb garden by the kitchen to  prepare great meals or simply relax...
neighborhood_overview:
We are at the foot hill of Mount Galiano for a wonderful hike and 10 min. on foot to Active pass beach or the Bluff & Bellhouse park.
The Pub, The Wild One , Daystore or Corner Store grocery/wine store market are 5 min. by car. Montague Park is an 8 minutes drive and the Pilgrim Restaurant is at 7 minutes, Robin and Crane is at 8 minutes . At the ferry terminal you will find Babes in the Woods, and the Galiano Inn at 12-15 minutes .
Our location is close to all amenities.
Our little paradise is secluded and very private.
host_about:
Hi, 

My name is Line Marie and I live on Galiano Island, BC.  Bernard and I have been living on Galiano for an average of 30 years and we can't find anywhere like it on earth.  We love sailing, hiking,camping , gardening and exploring.  
I am a mosaic artist and always looking for like minded people.

I have been in the accommodation business  for the last 30 years.   We enjoy people .   

We live in a very serene environment on one of the most scenic property in the Gulf Islands. We have built the house and we would like to host like minded people.  We are asking guests to view, Cowspiracy (it's free on Netflix) before booking with us.


Line Marie and family

description:
This home feels sunny and warm all year long!
People love walking into our home. They feel relaxed, comfy and welcome. The neighbourhood is safe and so beautiful! with every convenience that is funky and relaxed. The best bakeries/cafes 2-5 mins. away. Colourful, eclectic and warm, our house exudes the attitude that "Life is Good"! :) We Love hosting, so please join us!
See TC 'House Beautiful Aug.5, 2017' on our home.
We appreciate 1+ month stays! Talk to us about booking 1/2 rooms only!
neighborhood_overview: It's a quiet and safe area close to the water or 2 sides, full of gardens, both small and spectacularly magnificent.  We are walking distance from  cafes, shops and Abkhazi Gardens with tea room and gorgeous walkable gardens….a smaller, more local 'Butcharts' :)
host_about:
Sally Glover and Stuart Nemtin - fun-loving Canadians....Bohemian, artistic, environmental, musical and WE LOVE GREAT LOCAL FOOD, and this place is FAMOUS for spectacular food!!
We  Love getting into the cultural essence of people, food and language wherever we have the privelege of visiting!  Stu is a professional clown and fiddler, (Major Conrad Flapps) who has toured seven countries performing. Sally is a psychologist, coach and wellness trainer.

name: Foxglove Farm Classic Cottage B&B
description: Foxglove Farm is a 120-acre organic farm on Salt Spring Island in British Columbia, Canada. The farm is located on one of the original homesteads on the island nestled in a mountain, forest and lake ecosystem rich in flora, fauna and natural history.
neighborhood_overview:
Foxglove Farm is nestled in the heart of Salt Spring Island next to Mt. Maxwell Provincial Park. Abundant hiking and biking as well as quiet walks on the farm. It is located just 10 minutes outside of Ganges.

Foxglove Farm is nestled in a mountain, forest and lake ecosystem rich in flora, fauna and natural history. Surrounded by hundreds of acres of protected forest and agricultural fields, bordering Maxwell Lake, we are just minutes from hiking trails entering Mount Maxwell Provincial Park.
host_about:
Your hosts are Michael Ableman and Jeanne Marie Herman. 

Michael Ableman, farmer, author, photographer and food advocate, has been farming organically from since the 1970′s and is considered among the pioneers of the international movement. Renowned for his commercial scale organic farming techniques, Ableman has lectured audiences all over the world about the urban food revolution and agricultural conservation easement.

Jeanne Marie Herman has a B.A. in Environmental Studies, with minors in Botany and Urban Planning from the University of California at Santa Barbara, 1986. She has worked as a field biologist, an outdoor educator, environmental consultant, research project manager, education coordinator and farm manager. Jeanne Marie Herman was a founding board member of The Center for Urban Agriculture at Fairview Gardens in Goleta, Ca., At UCSB Geography Department she worked as a research technician for 5 years.

Jeanne-Marie is currently co-owner and founder of The Centre For Arts, Ecology, and Agriculture and partners with her husband, Michael Ableman, in managing Foxglove Farm.

name: Stunning 3BD vacation retreat!
description: Drenched in sunlight, this spectacular home edges on running paths and ocean walks, with boutiques, cafes, downtown Victoria and golf courses only minutes away! Feast in our newly renovated, spacious kitchen or barbeque in our sprawling yard. Our home is full of colour and light. Lounge in our comfortable beds, or in our living room in front of the fireplace, looking out onto the garden, yard and park. This is our family home, and we hope you enjoy it as much as we do.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is friendly and very safe!  Our home is on a tiny peninsula bordered with beaches on three sides, plus lawns, wild rabbits, beautiful gardens and a playground.  There are community potlucks in the park every Tuesday night, and all guests are welcome.  A large grocery store (Thrifty Foods) is about a 15-minute walk or five-minute drive, as is the nearest pub and Starbucks.  Wonderfully original boutique stores can be found on Oak Bay Avenue, a five- minute drive from the house.
host_about: Hi! I am born and raised in Canada, work in non-profit management, primarily for international community development and social justice organizations, and am a writer and mother of two kids, Anjali and Sage.  My partner, Peter, is a teacher at a local high school. We love to travel, and include Canada's Rocky Mountains, Jordan's Petra, Cambodia's Angkor Wat, and Guatemala among our favourite places in the world.  But we also love coming home to Victoria with its beautiful oceanside trails and mountain views.  We love opening our home to fellow travellers!

name: Oceanfront Cottage Galiano Island
description: Bright open–space living & dining area with a cozy wood burning fireplace. Furnished 2 bedroom cottage,1 queen and 2 double beds, and bathroom with walk-in shower. Our kitchen comes stored with dishes, cookware and appliances. The fireplace is a cozy accessory for those crisp winter days. The large 300 sq. ft. deck is the perfect place to relax on the deck chairs and enjoy the beautiful sunsets and views of spectacular Whaler Bay. There's also a propane BBQ so you can grill up your summer faves.
neighborhood_overview:

From $265 / weeknight low season to some $ 395 nights in summer. Prices based on 4 persons, additional guests are $30 / person / night. $100 cleaning fee on all bookings. 6 night minimum in summer, 5% discount on 7 nights.

And the warmth & openness of Galiano people.
Our neighbourhood is rural, quiet, private, & is in a transition area of three different types of forest within several hundred metres.

neighborhood_overview:
North and South Pender Islands lie between Vancouver and Victoria, below the 49th parallel, close to the US/Canada border above the San Juan Islands. The two Penders are joined by a scenic bridge over the canal that links Bedwell and Browning Harbours. The Penders have several open farm areas, many roadside stands selling summer produce, a lovely nine hole golf course, a 27-hole disc golf course, and not to mention many public beach access points and walking trails.

On North Pender, the best beach access points are Hamilton Beach on Browning Harbour and Medicine Beach on Bedwell Harbour. On South Pender, Mortimer Spit is a favourite sunny spot on Browning Harbour just across the canal bridge. As well, beaches at Craddock Road and Gowland Point offer a close look at some of Pender's interesting rock formations. Freshwater swimming may be enjoyed at the south end of Magic Lake and at Roe Lake.

The Driftwood Center offers a grocery store, bakery, bank, gift shop, liq

I built all of my homes myself, and I love bringing guests to my property and seeing their reaction when they see how beautiful they are.

host_about:
Born and raise on Vancouver Island, my first job was already in the hospitality business. I started career with the Banff Springs Hotel in my early 20's. I then worked at the Gastof Post Hotel in Lech, Austria, a small town in the Arlberg ski region. A few years later, I opened  Peaks Lodge, a mountain retreat and restaurant in Revelstoke, BC. I spent 10 years taking guests into the back-country on skiing and snowmobile tours. My strong passion for the ocean brought me back to the Island. I then decided  to open The Corbett Guest Suites and Adventures where I chose to bring fun and work together. Sharing my favorite hobbies with the house guests, activities such as bicycling, sailing, kayaking, fishing and crabbing are offered to anyone interested. Many other attractions and services are available in the near by area. I strive to ensure that my guests have a wonderful stay at the Corbett Guest Suites and an exciting visit to our beautiful town, “Sidney by the Sea.” 
Looking forward to meet new comers or welcoming back regulars!

name: Lovely home, great neighbourhood
description:
This quiet, friendly, family-oriented home is in a great location. It's a quick trip to downtown Victoria by car, bike & bus. Easy access to Vic General Hospital, Thetis Lake, Royal Roads University, Western Communities, West Coast beaches, Saanich Peninsula and Up-Island. Bike and hiking trails are minutes away. Or relax at home and enjoy the friendly neighbourhood and inviting garden.

Notes: The fireplace is not available.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a beautiful residential, suburban neighbourhood, unknown by most Victorians. I'm close to the water, just across the street from a small beach on Esquimalt Harbour. Thetis Lake is five minutes away by car, great for swimming and hiking. Esquimalt Lagoon, Fort Rodd Hill and Royal Roads (Hatley Castle gardens and trails) are also nearby, a joy to explore. I'm very close to the Galloping Goose and E&N bike trails.

PLEASE take a minute to check the map and confirm this is where you want to be. View Royal is about 7 km from downtown Victoria, easy to get to by car, bike or bus. But if you're looking for a more urban location, with lots of stores, restaurants and coffee shops, check out places right downtown or in Esquimalt, Vic West, Fairfield, Fernwood or James Bay.

View Royal is right at the junction of Vancouver Island and the Saanich Peninsula, so it's great base for exploring the whole South Island. You can head:
- East to visit Victoria
- We
host_about:
I live in Victoria, B.C. and love to travel. Paris is my home-away-from-home, and I've been to France many times. In the past few years, I have also fallen in love with Istanbul, Berlin, Lisbon, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Budapest, New York City, London, Tokyo, Kyoto, Hangzhou and Shanghai. 

I know what it's like to be both a guest and a host. I rent my whole house when I'm on the road, and share it with guests when I'm here. I like meeting and getting to know other travellers, collecting inspiration for future trips! I'm a casual and independent guest/host, comfortable to sit and chat, or do my own thing and let you do yours. 

The more I explore the world, the more I realize how lucky I am to live in Victoria. I see it with fresh eyes every time I come home, and am blown away yet again by how clean, fresh, beautiful and accessible it is.

host_about:
Passionate about life!   Love Victoria, and Love to travel!  Kyla (my fiance)  and I are healthy, fun loving people.  Enjoy doing anything that is different and adventurous.  

Our listings are all our own,  which we take great pride in!   And we love sharing them with fellow travellers!   We try to provide the same experience we would want when we travel!  :))

This past year we did the amazing Trans-Siberian railway and Mongolia,  and then later in the year we did a pre-baby trip to Portugal and Spain.     Bali is a favourite for us to unwind and find our inner peace!  We are busy bodies at home,  loving live theatre, yoga, training,  and being tourists in our own town!   Looking forward to sharing our city with you!

name: Gonzales Beach Character Home
description: Our many-bedroomed, sunny and cheerful, family-friendly home is situated in the leafy Fairfield area of Victoria, 1 short block away from 2 beautiful beaches! Our home sleeps 12; it has a lovely south-facing balcony, library, play-room, and open kitchen/dining area, conveniently located only 5 minutes from downtown and a short, 2 block walk from shopping and restaurants.
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is less than a minutes walk from sandy Gonzales Beach and 2 minutes from the Dallas Road seaside walkway with views of the Olympic mountains across the Strait of Juan de Fuca.
The Fairfield area is a neighbourhood filled with mature trees and many lovely gardens, including the famous Abkhazi gardens and the extensive gardens of Government House.
Ross Bay pub, Starbucks, sushi restaurant, pizza, liquor store, pharmacy, and groceries are all a 5 minute walk away.
host_about: I am an Anglican priest, the Rector of St. Barnabas Church near Fernwood in Victoria. I am married to Jasmin and we have 4 children aged 5-15 years.

Enjoy a relaxing, unplugged, spa experience in the wilderness of one of Vancouver Island's most beautiful rainforests!

The land of peace, tranquility and natural beauty. This custom built cabin is designed to welcome the outdoors in, the abundance of windows allows endless views of trees and stars by night. The home can comfortably sleep six people.

China beach and Mystic beach trail heads are a short walk away. Both are part of the Juan de Fuca provincial park ((website hidden)_de_fuca/). Cabin is also right near the turn off to access the Kludahk hiking trail (URL HIDDEN)
host_about: I like riding my bike, playing with my kiddos, walking my dog, sipping white wine on a hot summer day and exploring all of the beautiful nooks and crannies that beautiful British Columbia has to offer.  Sometimes I like leaving this province too... :)

name: Little Arbutus Loft
description: Cozy, two-bedroom loft cabin with wood stove. Just minutes away from China Beach and the Juan de Fuca trail.
neighborhood_overview:
Just a 25 minute walk to the beach through the campground and 5 minute drive to the beginning of the Juan de Fuca trail, the house is located in a quiet, thickly wooded neighborhood with little traffic or noise. For the most part at night you will only hear the crackle of the fire and the wind in the trees if you leave the windows open, though in the winter and spring the creek that runs across the back of the property can be heard too!

Though the house itself does not have cell phone coverage, there is satellite Internet, and just a fifteen minute drive towards Sooke is Shirley Delicious, a delightful cafe that serves excellent coffee, a wide variety of treats, soups, sandwiches and breakfast fixins, as well as offering internet service (vegan and gluten free options). There's cell coverage there too, so it's an excellent option to connect to the world. Just down in Jordan River, The Cold Shoulder cafe also serves great coffee and snacks.

For a romantic evening,

host_about:
Like you, I love to travel, including cruising. I love to help people. I love to be hospitable. I love to read, especially about the places I am about to visit in my travels and adventures.  My husband and I have visited most of the European countries, north and south, as well as: Turkey, Israel, Greece. Southeast Asia, and the Western Rockies of the United States and Western Canada. We have also visited the western shores of South America.

"What you know is a function of whom you choose to believe." This is my husband's (Ph.D.) saying. Of course, I believe it.

I just retired after thirty (30) years with one company. Now, I am enjoying sharing our  luxurious vacation resort (which has properties around the world and within the USA). Name any place on this globe, and I will try to help you make your dream vacation or travel experience come true. 

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Thank you,

Lorie

name: Beautiful oceanview suite near parks & wineries!
description: A bright, stylish main floor suite with a spacious yard and small orchard. Just a 5 minute drive to the airport and 10 minutes to the ferries. Walking distance to the ocean, dog parks, recreation center and Sea Cider Farm. Only a 15 minute drive to a half dozen amazing wineries, Butchart Gardens or the quaint Town of Sidney. Access to parks, beaches, farms, restaurants & coffee shops in every direction! This is your home away from home.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of North Saanich close to the Town of Sidney or quick access onto the Pat Bay Highway to zip downtown Victoria. I have quiet, friendly neighbours and live on a safe, flat street with tons of trails, beaches, farms and parks nearby. Panorama Rec Centre is just a 2 minute drive up the road and has a pool with waterslide, a skating rink, weight room, tennis and squash courts.

I'm just 5 minutes to the airport and 10 minutes to the ferry terminals for Anacortes/San Juan Islands, Vancouver and the Gulf Islands.

Favourite local eats include The Roost Farm Centre (with bakery and restaurant), the Prairie Inn Pub, CenSai Roll Sushi, Peninsula Pizza (take-out only), 10 Acres at The Pier, Sabhai Thai, and Maria's Souvlaki. Sea Cider Farm & Ciderhouse is just a 2 minute drive down the street (or 20 minute walk) and does great optional food pairings with their cider tastings. Worth the visit! Check out my guidebook for tons more suggestions.
host_about:
I love spending time with my little family! My husband and I have a toddler and a Vizsla, and we love to be outside, rain or shine. I enjoy cooking, but mostly I enjoy eating! And drinking good wine with good friends. 

We love to travel, but we also love being hosts. We look forward to meeting new people and seeing new places!

name: Seal Beach Cottage - Spacious waterfront 22 acres!
description:
Situated in 22 acres of untouched forest our charming cottage is just steps from a secluded sand and pebble beach with its incredible waterfront view, fabulous sunsets, trails, and active, diverse wildlife. A stunning 60-90 min ferry trip from the Mainland. No car required! Seal Beach is 3 km from the ferry. Only 1 km from restaurants, a coffee shop, bakery, and 2 great grocery stores. A happy place for children and dog friendly!
A wonderful get-away any time of year!
neighborhood_overview:
Mayne Island is one of BC's beautiful Southern Gulf Islands. From the Vancouver lower Mainland ferry terminal it is a 65 minute direct ferry trip and from Victoria it is 50 minutes. The ferry travels through some of the most gorgeous marine views Canada has to offer. Truly a West Coast experience! You can reach us by float plane from either destination in 20 minutes.

Although the cottage is tucked away from all signs of traffic, there are grocery stores, a bakery, pub, gift stores and the Summer Farmer's Market all conveniently within 2 km.

Beaches
Although many believe Seal Beach is the best beach on Mayne (with almost exclusive access to 1800' of sandy waterfront), there are other beaches you may want to explore. Bennett Bay Beach, Campbell Bay, Dinner Bay, and Piggott Bay Beach are popular spots and tend to have the warmest water. Most beaches are dog-friendly but please remember to pick up after your pets.

Japanese Gardens
Our magnificen
host_about: Our family has been on Mayne Island since 2013 and we love it! It is a charming and friendly community to which we continue to become more attached. We enjoy the outdoors and the beauty of the natural world that Mayne Island offers every day. We are very happy to share this peaceful and stunning location with our guests!

name: Macaulay Point Main House
description: Tranquil family home close to oceanfront parks in the beautiful Macaulay Point neighbourhood. This very private family home is situated on a corner lot on a quiet street, a short distance to downtown and all amenities. The house itself is comfortable and welcoming with gorgeous houseplants, custom woodworking, fir floors throughout and well equipped kitchen suitable for family gatherings.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhoods of Macaulay Point and Saxe Point take the name of their spectacular Oceanside parks that set the tone for this quiet, family oriented neighborhood.
host_about: We are an active family of four who enjoy this location as much as you will. We spend a great deal of time on and by the ocean, surfing, fishing, boating, hiking or staying close to home rooting around in the garden and cooking gourmet meals for family and friends.  Our location is ideal: close to the city and vibrant urban culture of Victoria yet surrounded by the quiet, natural beauty of oceanfront parks.  Our guesthouse offers everything we'd look for ourselves: the comforts and amenities of home with the luxury feel of a boutique hotel!  We are so privileged have this home business as every booking helps Nancy stay home more with the children while also enjoying the rewards of running a professional guesthouse - both jobs she does with love, care and attention to the little things!

name: Coles Bay Vacation Retreat / Beaches, Golf, Trails
description: Our Coles Bay Suite is a relaxing getaway to the country set up for a 6 night minimum stay. Sleeps up to 6 people with 2 bedrooms (queen size beds), bathroom with bath/shower, half bathroom (sink and toilet with towels & soap) outside of the suite but close by, living room with queen size Lazy Boy sleeping sofa.  Full kitchen & laundry facilities in the suite. Relax outside with a concrete deck area, table chairs, loungers & 6 burner gas barbecue. A home away from home!
neighborhood_overview: Coles Bay Vacation Retreat is located in the the countryside with a beach a 5 minute walk away and a golf course across the street. The property is on a third of an acre so it's spacious and private for everyone. The neighborhood is quiet and beautiful.The town of Sidney is 5 miles away, Victoria International Airport 3 miles away and Butchart Gardens, a favorite local attraction is a 15 minute drive. Victoria is 25 minutes by car.
host_about:
My husband Howie and I will be your hosts. My mother, Jan and step father, Maurie Turner completed building their home in 1978. This was intended to be and became their dream home. 

They have always wanted to create a bed and breakfast but never got around to it. My mother, unfortunately passed away in 2014. We are now full-filling her wish to open her home to guests from around the world to share and enjoy the beauty of Vancouver Island that we have had the privilege to call home for over 50 years.  

We are in a two phase process. We are opening the first suite in our house at the moment and will have an 1100 sq ft. guest home on the property available by spring. We are continuing my mother's love of flower gardens to create an inviting yard to sit and relax on a warm summer evening or pull a ripe apple or plum from my mother's fruit trees. 

I owned and rented a guest cottage in California back in the '80's and had so much fun and many wonderful memories with our clients. We look forward to meeting you and creating new ones!

description: Welcome to our lovingly renovated 1947 family home that we make available during our travels.  This fully  stocked space has lots of entertaining space, a professionally landscaped backyard haven with natural swim pond, dock, waterfalls, hot tub, outdoor shower, BBQ, pizza oven, ping pong, and more. Perfect for families touring Victoria or visiting friends and family nearby. Near Mt. Tolmie, UVIC/Camosun, 5 min drive to Cadboro Bay beach, bus routes, lots of parking.
neighborhood_overview: The Mt. Tolmie neighbourhood is centrally located. Downtown (15 min drive), bus routes, UVIC/Camosun College, beach (5 min drive), shops & restaurants within walking distance. Located directly across from Horner Park with playground, basketball courts & green space. Right across the street you can hike Mt. Tolmie for gorgeous 360 degree views of Victoria, Vancouver Island, Olympic Mountains, Gulf Islands & San Juan Islands.
host_about: An avid lover of life who take inspiration from travel & nature with the willingness to share my home for others to enjoy while I am away. name: Mossy Hill Guesthouse
description: Relax and enjoy yourselves in our two bedroom guest suite.
neighborhood_overview: We live on a quiet street with neighboring house far apart. The street has low traffic and well-suited for a nice walk. There is a conservancy park in the walking distance through the historic road used in the olden days to get around the island. Please ask us for directions how to get there.
host_about:
We are a couple living on Salt Spring Island for about 14 years and loving it. Four years ago,  we have decided to become  self-sufficient and planted an orchard with fig, pear and apple trees as well as grapes and blueberries. Although we both  grew up in the big cities, we enjoy the country life style and comfort of our home with lovely two  cats, Mister and Lizka.  

Our property is a 3 minute drive to Ganges yet it is away from the main road in a peaceful setting. The herb garden outside of the suite offers our guests fresh ingredients for their culinary needs.  If you have an eye for detail, you will notice a tasteful touch in the interior design of the suite done by Bruce . We value the privacy of our guests by having their own entrance, an outside picnic area with the barbecue  and their own driveway.  

One of the many aspects that drew us to this property,  is the 90 million year old conglomerate that was once an under ocean landslide. The entire acre is seated firmly on the rock featuring fascinating encapsulated clasts of quartz and granite. This background  is constantly inspiring the creativity in us manifesting in continuous evolution of additional adornments via mosaics,  woodwork and landscape ideas.

name: GORGEOUS HERITAGE HOME walk to town
description:
Fullly restored 1910 Home. High ceilings, original stained glass, lavishly decorated with antiques from around the world. The front porch is large and private with lush garden view. Grand piano too. Walkable neighbourhood with cafes & shops. Gorgeous park with views of city within 10 min walk. Walk to ferry's express bus stop and downtown. Sorry not suitable for children under 10.

* Victoria short term rental license #00038331
neighborhood_overview:
This is a fun and dynamic neighbourhood. Just a block away the amenties are terrific: Fairways Supermarket has the best selection of ethnic foods in the city and open till 11 pm. Cascadia Liquor Store is open late too. Selection of restaurants - Indian, Carribean, "Part and Parcel" for neighbourhood fine dining & popular pub with great food - the wood fired Fifth St Bar & Grill ... and two blocks away is the heavenly Cafe Fantastico!

There's also a beautiful park overlooking the city that is a Garibaldi Oak Sanctuary - it has a small playground for children and a pretty wooded trail.
host_about:
I'm a professional working in the arts who has been fortunate to visit and live in many countries.   My home is my sanctuary and is filled with things I love which I hope you'll enjoy and care for as if they were your own.     

I'm situated in a great jumping off point to explore the city and I'd be happy to give you some tips while you're here.   

Please contact me if I can be of help!

name: Entire 5 bedroom Home - Cook Street Village
description:
5 bedroom Craftsman Home in Cook St Village - the best neighbourhood in Victoria.

We are close to all the good things - Beacon Hill Park, Dallas Rd, and Downtown.

The home can accommodate 10 people. 4 Queen Beds and one double bed.

Great for families, with a play area in the back for kids.

Entire Home. The home is not shared with anyone.

Victoria awaits your arrival. This lovely character home is full of charm and warmth.


STR Licence # 00040814
neighborhood_overview: The  general area is known as Cook St Village.   The house is located 2 blocks away from the village amongst a neighbourhood of quaint homes and tree lined streets.   In the village, you'll find a friendly vibe and many different amenties including grocery stores, restaurants, coffee shops, a local butcher, liquor store, charming boutiques and a British-inspired pub.   The surrounding area features parks, playgrounds, beaches and more.
host_about:
I am Drew Tupper. I am a life coach, husband, dad, enjoyer of pickleball, gardening, rock climbing and travelling. 

I love personal growth, being of service, and creating the lives of our dreams.

I live on Vancouver Island. The best place in Canada.

We have an old home in Victoria which I have lovingly restored. Check out the photos. 

I have lived and worked in Japan, Italy and the Caribbean (Grenada). 

I look forward to meeting you. 

Drew

Our guest house is located on the grounds of Becher Bay Marina and to the left of E. Sooke park. The Marina's quiet beach and friendly neighborhood make for a memorable stay. The house is fully equipped everything you need to make outstanding meals.

I am so pleased to announce that our beloved Marina House has just undergone an extensive Renovation. I am updating pictures between guests. please feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions about our facilities.

name: Two Story House Close to Nature
description: Modern home for up to 6 people in quiet cul de sac in Langford, adjacent to beautiful Thetis Lake Park.  Nature trails, swimming, pubs, shopping nearby.  Wi-fi included. Significant discounts for longer stays.
neighborhood_overview:
Single family homes mainly. Our house is in a quiet cul de sac so there is no drive-through traffic; neighbors meet and chat, and children often play in the street. There are two pubs, two restaurants, and a number of fast-food places within a kilometer (5 minute drive).
We have left an Information Binder in the house with lots more information on the neighborhood and things to do in Victoria.
host_about: I am semi-retired consulting geologist.  I travel around BC and Alberta a lot between jobs, mostly in the fall/winter.  My husband John is also retired and we like to stay active, we enjoy camping, hiking and travelling.  Neither of us smoke and we don't have pets. We have no food hang ups or allergies, although John really does love steaks.  We are strong environmentalists and love the wild spaces.  We enjoy meeting people on our travels which is why we decided to try AIRBNB.  We have 3 grown sons and 3 grandchildren.

name: Cozy 2 bedroom suite in quiet area of Victoria
description:
2 bed 1 bath basement suite, just a 10 minute walk from UVIC and a 15-20 minute drive or bus ride to downtown Victoria. Our home is close to all amenities including grocery & liquor stores, Tim Hortons, Starbucks, 7-11, and Popeyes Chicken. There are also many nice beaches within a 5-10 minute drive, as well as Mt. Doug Park with many nice hiking trails.

We have also recently added 2 new queen size beds, as well as an updated double hide-a-bed, along with cotton sheets and fans to keep cool.
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is situated in a quiet residential neighbourhood located 15-20 minutes north of Victoria's downtown core (drive/bus time). We offer free on-street parking directly in front of our house. There is ample room if you have 2 cars or you have a large truck/RV.

If you are coming to Victoria via BC Ferries, we are a 30 minute drive south from the Swartz Bay ferry terminal by car, but by bus it will take about 90 minutes. From the Victoria International Airport, it's about a 30 minute drive by car but by bus it's closer to 90 minutes as well.

How to get to our neighbourhood from the Swartz Bay ferry terminal by bus: Once you walk out of the ferry terminal, take either bus #70 or #72 called "Downtown". Stay on the bus until you get to downtown Victoria, which will take anywhere from 45-60 minutes depending on traffic. Once you are downtown you will want to take bus "27: Gordon Head" headed East/North out of town until it reaches the stop of Blair Avenue and Birc

name: Celtic Place Mountainside Chalet
description:
Modern Chalet on 10 secluded acres on Mt Maxwell. 10 minutes drive from Ganges. Limited ocean views from the property. Wheelchair access, handicap friendly, roll in shower with grab rails.
Sleeps 8. Large sitting room. Free wifi. Wood stove.
Cost for 2 persons is $ 299.00 per night weekdays, $ 329.00 at weekends ( Fri and Sat nights). For over 2 people the added cost is $ 35.00 per night for all persons over 2 years of age. Kids under 2 free. There is a one time cleaning fee $ 195.00.
neighborhood_overview: We are on 10 secluded acres at 1300 feet above sea level on Mt Maxwell.  Deer roam freely but there are no bears. It is very quiet and peaceful here and we ask our guests to honour that for the sake of others in our main house accommodation, and that they do the same. There is a private mountain trail on the property, an easy 30 minute walk up hill and back down the loop.

neighborhood_overview: House/Townhouse
host_about: Victoria Prime is the superior way to find a vacation rental, corporate housing, or a short term furnished rental in Victoria. We are a personal property management company, which means we work with you individually to discover what kind of rental you are looking for, and then we make it happen for you. We offer only the highest quality properties and service. Whether you are looking for vacation homes or condo rentals, we have properties ranging from beach houses to one bedroom suites in Victoria's Downtown Inner Harbour and everything in between.

name: Acre By The Sea Guest Suite - Stunning Ocean Views
description:
Welcome to Acre By The Sea Guest Suite, a bright, woodsy West Coast Hideaway.
2-floor Artist loft with stunning Ocean views, beautiful garden acre, in Otter Point. Spacious (850 sq ft) with modern furnishings. Sleeps 2-6.

Ground level private entrance; kitchenette, dining space; comfortable living room; 3 pc bathroom with heated floors; a beautiful rebuilt loftstairs; deluxe Queen, Double and Murphy beds.

Cable TV, wifi, parking, Nespresso, BBQ.

Winter Special: Adult Spa Package available.
neighborhood_overview:
You will enjoy a rural setting with close proximity to both Nature, and Sooke town amenities (located 8km), and only minutes to several beaches.
Nearby activities offer include beach combing, old growth forests and nature trails, charter fishing, horseback riding, whale watching, bike/ kayak/paddle boarding opportunities within minutes.
Here, you may also enjoy the quietness of being away from a city, or the brilliance of the stars enhanced by the darkened night sky.
Fall in love with the uniqueness of our area, as you watch the fog roll in over the water; hear the sound of the waves rolling, the voices of the Sea Lions; the smell of the fresh sea air, and excitement of spotting whales from the comforts of our front yard or the loft window.

Some of our favourite nearby spots:
1 block from Otter Point rocks and small public park with shoreline fishing access.
1-2 km from Gordon's beach, an easy 10-15 walk.
4km from Muir creek
8km from

name: Bright, spacious, close to downtown Victoria, BC.
description: Expansive and peaceful 2 bedroom top floor suite filled with natural light. Designer and artistic touches in this spacious Heritage home (1,250 sq ft). Enjoy our private gardens, quaint neighbourhood, and beautiful views. Two blocks to the Songhees ocean walkway,  harbour tours and water taxi. Mere 3 minute drive or 15 minute walk to downtown Victoria, BC.
neighborhood_overview:
Vic West is a fresh and vibrant neighbourhood with a thriving community feel, great walks, local markets and within walking distance along the sea wall to downtown Victoria.

The house is located on a quiet street 2 blocks to the ocean. Tall hedges protect an English garden within.

Three blocks to tennis courts, parks and swimming in the Gorge.

Market Garden, Fol Epi, Caffe Fantastico, Fry's Bakery, the Spiral Cafe, Boom and Batten, Spinnaker's Brew Pub, Glo Restaurant and La Taqueria are all quality establishments that are within walking distance.
host_about:
I love to travel and have lived overseas for a good part of my life.
I am passionate about growing food,  enjoy cooking and fine wine!
I'm involved in a creative field which I express in my daily living.
I live my life so that I have no regrets!

name: Cusheon Lake Resort Cedar Chalets
description: Our Cedar Chalets feature a bedroom with a comfortable Queen bed. The loft has 3 or 4 single beds and a double sofa-bed in the living area. Each cabin has a bathroom with bath &/or shower, a well-stocked kitchen, TV & Wifi.
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Salt Spring Island!

Salt Spring is the largest and best-known island of the Gulf Islands. Known for its largely unspoiled forests and beaches, Salt Spring is populated by free spirited, easy going, everyday folk who truly experience west coast living. Filled with wineries, hills, specialty food producers, coffee shops, spas, pottery shops, Barb’s Buns, the Tree House Café, and of course the Saturday Market – Salt Spring has lots to see and do.

Mountains:
Mt Erskine has almost 240 hectares of protected land with a variety of trails. It’s a fairly easy hike and once you react the top you won’t be disappointed by the view! On the way up, keep your eye out for fairy doors as the mountain is home to Erskine the Elf! Another great mountain to check out is Mt Maxwell as it is the tallest point on the island. By taking a turn on Rainbow road you are able to drive all the way up the mountain.

Saturday Market:

name: Family Ocean View Victorian Executive Swartz Bay
description: Spend your stay on Vancouver Island in a beautiful Victorian Mini Mansion! Located minutes away from the Swartz Bay Ferry from Vancouver, the Victoria Airport and the seaside town of Sidney. 25 minutes to the beautiful city of Victoria and the world famous Butchart Gardens, Craigdarroch Castle Fisherman's Wharf and so many other attractions!
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is quiet and peaceful. The house is situated near the end of a dead end road with access to Horth Hill Regonal Park just a few steps away. You can occasionally see a ferry sail by or enjoy a drink on the upper balcony.
It's very private yet close enough to Sidney with its shopping and restaurants as well as beaches!
host_about: We are a couple who want to share our lovely home with others.

name: Comfortable country house steps from the ocean
description: Our house is a warm and inviting house with a huge deck and we get a lot of sunshine. It is a charming neighbourhood, very quiet and off the beaten track just 3 minutes from the shoreline. We have views out over the ocean and the mountains behind. We rent out the entire house for a minimum of 1 week at at time but would prefer a longer rental period. We are looking to rent the entire house out for 3 months starting in January 2018 until the end of March 2018.
neighborhood_overview: The properties around here are all fairly large and there are no streetlights at night so for star gazers it is a great place. It is also very quiet with very little traffic noise. We do hear the planes coming in but it is not an intrusive sound as we are not under the flight path.
host_about: My husband and I are both recently retired from teaching and physiotherapy and ready now for a new phase of life. We would like to welcome guests to our house as we have the space and time to do it and we really enjoy meeting new people.We are both outdoor enthusiasts and are only steps from the ocean where we often go down and either swim or canoe, and meet with the neighbours for a picnic supper while watching the beautiful sunsets. We are happy to advise you on all the possible activities you can do in this area.

name: Family friendly 4 bedroom house
description:
The PERFECT rental for one large family or two smaller families. Our lovely home is located walking distance from beautiful Willows Beach and Uplands Park, quaint Oak Bay Village, funky Fernwood Village! It's also a very short drive, bus or bike ride to Victoria's historic downtown and waterfront.

Includes both levels of the home, with private entrances for both, sunny back deck and massive private backyard.

Amazing location in quiet neighborhood close to everything!

Welcome Home!
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located minutes from some of the area's most beautiful beaches (Willows, Cadboro Bay) and interesting neighborhoods (Oak Bay Village, Fernwood Village). Pick up a morning coffee from one of the numerous cafe's in the area, and take a leisurely stroll down to the beach to catch the morning sun. Enjoy afternoons exploring the trendy shops in Oak Bay or grab some lunch at the marina downtown while you watch the float planes come and go in front of the Legislature Building. You will have your pick of dozens of restaurants in the area - from Italian to Tapas to good old fashioned English pub fare, the diversity is delicious!
host_about: We are easy going, outdoorsy, young professionals.  Hiking, snowboarding, kayaking, nature walks with our dogs, and cooking good food with friends are all things we cannot live without.  We both love to travel, and are happy to share our home with other travelers visiting the Victoria area.  Enjoy the comforts of our home while you explore this beautiful city!

Fully fenced backyard! Beautiful, bright, & private 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom house with a large outdoor living area and all the comforts of home!
Quiet neighbourhood, close to a park, shopping malls, trails, very convenient location in Victoria and just a 5 minute drive to downtown.
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is very quiet and safe, close to grocery stores, shopping malls, Parks, coffee shops and bakery's, and a short drive to the downtown core.
host_about: We are a family of 4 who love to travel and explore new places. We have also been Airbnb hosts for a number of years and absolutely love being able to be part of this community!

name: Waterside House on Horton Bay
description: Beach house with park like grounds fenced and gated  for privacy and pets to enjoy. Home is south facing with three floors of windows providing unobstructed  water views from every room. Stairs lead to pebble beach and private 40' deep water dock.
neighborhood_overview: Mayne's only all tide boat launch is within a half mile from Waterside House. All of the Islands amenities are within a 5 mile radius. Horton Bay is the most popular bay for boaters to anchor in the protection of this tranquile calm  Bay. Mayne Island has all the services of a resort community and many local artists galleries and shops to explore. Bike and kyack rentals are available and professionally guided tours on water and land can be arranged by your hosts.
host_about: Recently retired husband of a professional wife partner owner of two properties on Mayne Island. Interest include vintage motorcycles, sustainable living, renewable energy, airedale terriers, student of old world building and framing, saw-milling and cooking. Entertaining, learning from and sharing with others is a life priority.

name: Bamboo Grove
description: We are located on Channel Ridge looking toward Vancouver Island at approximately 450 ft. elevation. This makes us about eye level with the eagle's nest in the front yard. Our custom property on 5 secluded acres is an elegant West Coast contemporary built in 2005 that offers absolute privacy, sensational ocean vistas, and majestic forests with rambling trails for hiking, or biking on several hundred adjacent wild acres.
neighborhood_overview: What makes the neighborhood unique are the wide ocean views, the eagles, hawks, and ravens overhead, the deer that wander through the property, and the trails that surround us and explore the wild land on Channel Ridge.

name: The "Nest" on Galiano Island ~5 min to the beach
description:
Secluded 3-acre Forest Retreat at Galiano Island.
We call our house "The Nest" as it was designed to replicate a bird. The wings splay out to form the bedrooms on either side of the house. The exterior shakes are cut to resemble feathers.
Perfect to accommodate up to 8 people (3 bed/2bath + an outdoor shower).
8 minute walk to the golf course, 5 minute walk to the beach. 4 km from the ferry. Kayaks, bikes and golf clubs available to guests. Walking distance to restaurant and grocery store.
neighborhood_overview: The Nest is located in a family neighbourhood. Close to the ferry (4km), beach (5 minutes walk) and golf course (10 minutes walk).

name: Victoria, BC Canada, 2 Bedroom Twins #2
description:
Listing is entered as USD currency. Please check with AirBnB to ask if they are converting the currency to CAD.

I can accept a 1-night stay for a weekend night (Friday or Saturday) if the date is within 2 days of stay date.

Two Bedroom: Queen in master, twins in second bedroom, queen murphy bed in living area. Maximum occupancy 6.
neighborhood_overview:
Victoria is a sophisticated gem of timeless quality, named for one of history’s most remarkable women. With a temperate climate and British Colonial heritage, Victoria is a perfect destination year-round. Sights include the world-famous Butchart Gardens, Royal British Columbia Museum and the amazing Victoria Butterfly Gardens. Stroll through Goldstream park where salmon spawn, eagles fly and waterfalls cascade down cliffs. After a full day, head back to the resort to linger over tea. The rooms are angled to maximize water views, and the fireplace will keep you cozy as you look out over the moonlit bay.

Popular Attractions
The Butchart Gardens
Located on an expansive country estate, the 55-acre gardens feature floral displays, meandering paths and expansive lawns. 15 mi.

Royal BC Museum and IMAX Theatre
Learn about the human and natural history of British Columbia through exciting exhibits at the Royal BC Museum. The museum also features the 400-seat
host_about: I love to travel and help others fulfill all of their traveling needs!

neighborhood_overview:
Popular Attractions
The Butchart Gardens
Located on an expansive country estate, the 55-acre gardens feature floral displays, meandering paths and expansive lawns. 15 mi.

Royal BC Museum and IMAX Theatre
Learn about the human and natural history of British Columbia through exciting exhibits at the Royal BC Museum. The museum also features the 400-seat National Geographic IMAX Theatre, which has five different 45-minute films showing daily. ¾ mi.

Victoria Bug Zoo
A visit to this must see zoo offers visitors an excellent opportunity to view and experience multi-legged creatures from around the world in a safe, fun and friendly atmosphere. 1 1/2 miles.

Annual Festivals
February: Victoria Film Festival, Victoria Tea Festival

March: Annual Victoria French Fest

April: Victoria Performing Arts Festival

May:Uno Festival, Victoria Highland Games

June: Jazzfest

July: Ska Festival, Ta

name: Oceanfront low bank home viewing Mt. Baker.
description: Beautiful cedar home on a secluded half acre with breathtaking views of Saturna, the San Juan's and Mt. Baker. Amazing rock fireplace, large fully stocked country kitchen, sunroom with 180 degree view of it all. The home has three bedrooms, two bathrooms and a den. Two large ocean-view decks, a hot tub overlooking the ocean and a tidal islet where otters, seals and birdlife congregate, and even the occasional Orca sighting!
neighborhood_overview: Pender Island is the Southernmost of the Gulf Islands, located along the Pacific Coast of British Columbia, Canada. Pender Island enjoys a sub-Mediterranean climate and features open farmland, rolling forested hills, several lakes and small mountains, as well as many coves and beaches. In fact, the Pender Islands offer more public beach access points than any of the Gulf Islands. Pender is a great place to kayak, bike, whale watch, or wine taste. South Pender is much quieter than North Pender, with only 300 year round residents. Our home is just a short drive or bike ride to Mt. Norman Federal Park, Poet's Cove Resort & Spa, Greenburn Lake and Gowlland Point all of which offer beautiful views of the Southern Gulf Islands.
host_about: Peter and I live and work in Vancouver but love the simple life of the Gulf Islands! Peter works as a pilot and I'm a registered nurse. We have three almost grown children. We live in Vancouver and escape to South Pender for nature, quiet and relaxation.

name: Fernwood Family House
description:
Welcome to our four bedroom family home in the heart of Fernwood.

Our home offers an open concept recently updated kitchen and living room, two bathrooms and three bedrooms on the main upper floor with another bedroom and office on the entrance level.

One bedroom has a king size bed with an ensuite bathroom, the 2nd bedroom has a twin bed that can be converted to a king, the 3rd bedroom has a twin bed. The 4th bed downstairs has a double bed.

City of Victoria Business licence 00040607
neighborhood_overview:
We live in the heart of Fernwood... just blocks from the Fernwood Inn, Stage Wine Bar and the Belfry Theatre. In Fernwood Square, you can also find a convenience store, a local artisan and thrift store, a consignment store, and a Mexican restaurant.

It’s about a 25 minute walk to downtown and the beach or a short drive.

name: Spacious Family Friendly Suite
description:
Our large, clean and comfortable suite is great for families with a massive kitchen/living room studio + 2BR, 4 beds (1 queen, 1 double and 2 singles (bunk bed)) and a crib. We are a 5 minute walk to Thetis Lake and have easy access to Victoria's amazing attractions. Our location serves as a great launching point for day trips up island or in and around Victoria.

Important to note that we live on the upper floor of the house and have 3 growing, and sometimes noisy boys.
neighborhood_overview:
We are just a 5 minute walk to Thetis Lake. This location is a great place to see the island from. 10 minute drive to Goldstream Provincial Park, 15 minutes to Esquimalt Lagoon, Fort Rodd National Park, and Downtown Victoria.

It's a quiet and kid friendly neighbourhood.
host_about:
We are an active outdoor family. We spend every weekend we can outside exploring trails, beaches, and sunsets. Our boys are school age and we keep them active! In the summer it's the great outdoors. Jim n Erin

name: Your island home away from home 4 BR suite
description: We are on a peninsula which is semi-rural, in the midst of farmland, small villages, beaches and mountains.  We are surrounded by lush flower gardens and hummingbirds almost year round.  Fresh fruit and produce are plentiful from many gardens. Note: From Sept 15 - April 15 stay 3 days or more get next day free.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the small village of Saanichton, with bank, pharmacy, post office and grocery store. Also medical clinic just down the street.
There is a summer market just around the corner on Saturday mornings and a Thursday evening street market in Sidney, 10 minutes away.
We are on a peninsula so there are beaches and water sports, i.e., kayaking and paddle boarding, very close by.
host_about: We are originally from Georgia in the United States.  We are retired, parents of 4 adult children and 12 grandchildren.   We love being outdoors exercising, gardening, hiking, kayaking.  We have lived here for 30 years and have travelled to many places with our children through the years.  Our favorite would have to be Vanuatu where we spent 6 months in 1994.

name: FANTASTIC!! JUBILEE 4 BDRM
description: 30 nights for the price of 21!. Come and Enjoy our resident Oak Trees from our 2200 sf 4 bedroom house.  With 2 Master bedrooms,  we combined island reclaimed finishing with the most modern conveniences.  I'm sure you will love it as much as we do!
neighborhood_overview: We are one block from the Jubilee Hospital.  Central to everything.  6 minutes to downtown.  3 minutes to all amenities.
host_about:
Passionate about life!   Love Victoria, and Love to travel!  Kyla (my fiance)  and I are healthy, fun loving people.  Enjoy doing anything that is different and adventurous.  

Our listings are all our own,  which we take great pride in!   And we love sharing them with fellow travellers!   We try to provide the same experience we would want when we travel!  :))

This past year we did the amazing Trans-Siberian railway and Mongolia,  and then later in the year we did a pre-baby trip to Portugal and Spain.     Bali is a favourite for us to unwind and find our inner peace!  We are busy bodies at home,  loving live theatre, yoga, training,  and being tourists in our own town!   Looking forward to sharing our city with you!

name: Stunning Ocean View Cottage - 3 Bedroom
description:
Our gorgeous cottage offers spectacular ocean views, 2 decks, cozy gas fireplace, gourmet kitchen and 3 queen beds. The cottage has 20" ceilings, with 18 foot ocean-facing windows. A large deck off the kitchen provides spectacular ocean views while the south windows showcase a forest view. The backyard is a space to soak up the forest views around the fire pit.

The cottage is a place to recharge, rejuvenate and connect with nature. It is located on the Pacheedaht First Nations territory.
neighborhood_overview:
Escape to nature. The cottage is located high on a cliff in the heart of little Renfrew alongside the San Juan Bay. There are stairs a few feet away that take you down to the beach and marina.

A 10 minute walk takes you to the Coastal Kitchen and Renfrew pub; a 15 minute walk to the General Store and 5 minutes to the coffee shop.

Our cottage is nestled in the Wild Coast Coast Cottage complex. We are one of the few ocean facing properties with outdoor space. Trees around the property protect the cottage providing privacy.
host_about: My husband and I love to travel. I am a business owner, writer and teacher. We are meticulous and always want to stay in unique but well maintained properties. We appreciate a clean house!

name: "Islandia" 2-Room Combo Waterfront
description:
So Kirk actually runs the Airbnb, assisted by Coco the cat. Jon is the property owner. Sunny oceanfront, western sunsets, shoreline, decks and hot tub. It's pretty spectacular, whether during warm days of summer or storm season with breakers crashing on the rocks.

Start with a simple brekkie then explore the rugged shoreline, artisan studios, markets, restaurants. Return to relax in the hot tub with a glass of wine and quite time.

This is an informal home filled with art and a great view.
neighborhood_overview:
This is the north west part of the island about 12 minutes away from Ganges Village. There is a small coffee shop nearby and beside the Vesuvius Ferry Terminal there is a Seaside Grill for great fish and chips, ice cream,and full meals in their restaurant or on their deck over the water. (dinner reservations recommended). In between Vesuvius Bay and Ganges is the famous Fritz Cinema, the Gulf Island's only cinema screening first run movies nightly at 7 p.m. and a Sunday matinee at 3 p.m. We will have over 50 studios with local art, crafts and food specialities. An Art Studio Tour map is available for you upon arrival. Don't miss the SSI cheese places!
The neighbourhood is quiet and we need to respect that.
host_about:
I'm a semi-retired mechanical engineer, specializing in product development. Have travelled a lot around this globe, and genuinely like travellers. 

By the way, when I'm away travelling myself, either Kirk or Lara might be your gracious host.

description: A beautiful 3 bedroom home located near the picturesque town of Sidney by the Sea. description:
**Please note that our property is available for rentals that are 30 days or more - monthly rates are found in the rates section**
Our place is close to beautiful downtown Victoria. We are a 10 minute walk from the inner harbour and Beacon Hill Park and are close to the ocean, Fisherman's Wharf as well as many other Victoria attractions. You’ll love our place because it is among the nicest completely refurbished heritage homes in James Bay, one of Victoria's premier historical neighbourhoods.
neighborhood_overview: James Bay is Victoria's premier historical neighbourhood.  It is populated with beautiful heritage homes and buildings including those of historical figures like Emily Carr.  The neighbourhood is wonderfully situated.  It is bordered on the south and west by the ocean, the north by the downtown core, and in the east by beautiful Beacon Hill Park.  It has walkable amenities such as 24 hr groceries, coffee shops, book stores, liquor store, fisherman's wharf as well as several eclectic brunch places and lovely restaurants.

name: 2BdmCondo Victoria WorldMark Resort#4
description: My place is close to restaurants and dining, the beach, family-friendly activities, nightlife, and public transport. You’ll love my place because of the light, the comfy bed, the coziness, and the kitchen. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and big groups.
neighborhood_overview:
Things to See and Do in Victoria
Whether you arrive by Kenmore Air, The Victoria Clipper or the BC Ferries, you're likely to have a little time to fill before you can officially check-in to WorldMark Victoria. Head down to the resort to drop off your bags (the front desk staff will keep an eye on them) and stroll over to Fisherman's Wharf, located just a few hundred feet west. Make a stop at Barb's Place, where you'll find the freshest fish and tastiest chips in town. Sit at the outdoor tables and dine alfresco.

Victoria's Parliament buildings are a 15-minute walk away, and behind them you'll find the starting point for a horse-drawn adventure by Tally-Ho Sightseeing. Enjoy a one-hour overview of local attractions during a leisurely-paced, horse-drawn sightseeing experience. For a different tour experience, try Big Bus Victoria that has hop-on and hop-off sightseeing tours. Familiarize yourself with the locations of the Empress Hotel, Royal British Columbia Museum, Thun
host_about:
Like you, I love to travel, including cruising. I love to help people. I love to be hospitable. I love to read, especially about the places I am about to visit in my travels and adventures.  My husband and I have visited most of the European countries, north and south, as well as: Turkey, Israel, Greece. Southeast Asia, and the Western Rockies of the United States and Western Canada. We have also visited the western shores of South America.

"What you know is a function of whom you choose to believe." This is my husband's (Ph.D.) saying. Of course, I believe it.

I just retired after thirty (30) years with one company. Now, I am enjoying sharing our  luxurious vacation resort (which has properties around the world and within the USA). Name any place on this globe, and I will try to help you make your dream vacation or travel experience come true. 

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Thank you,

Lorie

neighborhood_overview:
Please be advised that last minute bookings might not get the Condo unit overlooking the water, but a partial view only.

Victoria is a sophisticated gem of timeless quality, named for one of history’s most remarkable women. With a temperate climate and British Colonial heritage, Victoria is a perfect destination year-round. Sights include the world-famous Butchart Gardens, Royal British Columbia Museum and the amazing Victoria Butterfly Gardens. Stroll through Goldstream park where salmon spawn, eagles fly and waterfalls cascade down cliffs. After a full day, head back to the resort to linger over tea. The rooms are angled to maximize water views, and the fireplace will keep you cozy as you look out over the moonlit bay.

name: East Sooke Hillside Retreat
description: This three bedroom home is located in rural East Sooke, just a 45 minute drive from Victoria-but a world away. Spectacular views across Becher Bay and the Salish Sea to the Olympic mountains beyond, a few minutes from one of the premier hiking parks in Southern Vancouver Island, a refuge of peace and quiet.
neighborhood_overview:
The cottage is in East Sooke, a forested rural area surrounded by the ocean, full of walking/cycling trails. It is about 20 minutes from Sooke, a village further up the coast. Beyond Sooke lies the Juan de Fuca hiking trail, a number of beautiful beaches that make good day trips, and Port Renfrew (less than 2 hours away).

It is close to the marvelous trails of East Sooke Park, and not far from the Galloping Goose Trail, a converted railway line perfect for walking and cycling. In the summer, there is swimming 10 minutes away in Matheson Lake, and at the Sooke Potholes (about 20 minutes away). There's local produce at the market in Metchosin on the weekend, as well as at local produce stands.
host_about: We live in beautiful Victoria BC Canada, and enjoy the outdoors-kayaking, boating, hiking.

neighborhood_overview:

Just 5 minutes walk to the north is MOSS ROCK PARK, a perfect place to see the sunrise with south view of snow-capped Olympic Mountain in the USA and west birdview of downtown Victoria.

name: 2 BDR Suite, Oceanfront Beach/Dock 15 min Victoria
description: A stay at this waterfront Airbnb 2 bedroom suite is a truly unique vacation experience. Located in Brentwood Bay, breathtaking views of the ocean. Guests also have access to kayaks and fishing equipment so they can explore the area at their leisure. There is also a hot tub with direct waterfront access, making it the ideal spot to watch for orcas passing by or take in an ocean side sunset. If that's not enough, the suite also boasts its very own private dock that leads directly to the beach.
neighborhood_overview:
Brentwood Bay is a lovely village with all of the basic amenities available- excellent restaurants (three on the waterfront), pubs, bakery, butcher, grocery store, pharmacy, gift shops, coffee shops, yoga studio, a five star spa, liquor store and cold beer and wine shop to name a few.

There are fantastic beaches, hikes, water-side walks, fishing, water sports, world-class scuba diving (complete with local scuba company), the famous Butchart Gardens, Butterfly Gardens, local eco tours, and more. Other local activities include paddle board yoga, kayak tours, and glass-bottom boat eco tours...to name only a few.

Brentwood Bay is only 20 minutes from Victoria but gives you easier access to the amazing outdoor adventures that Vancouver Island has to offer.
host_about:
I live in Brentwood Bay, British Columbia, with my husband, Dallas, and two daughters. We are an active bunch and share a love of food, fun, and adventures with family and friends. 

As a first generation Canadian, travelling is in my genes. We love to meet new people, explore new places, and introduce others to the amazing island on which we live.

name: Spectacular Ocean View Cottage, Port Renfrew
description:
Fish Tales Cottage is a modern, self-catering, two level, 1300 sq.ft., fully furnished detached residence. Accommodates up to 8 guests and is pet friendly!
Visitors to the peaceful community of Port Renfrew will discover everything from world class fishing, an abundance of wildlife, miles of ocean shores including beautiful Botanical Beach to adventurous hiking trails in the majestic rainforest. Port Renfrew is an all-season destination and winter is the perfect time for storm watching.
neighborhood_overview: Port Renfrew is a quaint village on the west coast of Vancouver Island. Here visitors will discover beautiful beaches and giant trees in old growth forests. It's also an excellent place to go fishing, hiking, kayaking, canoeing, paddle boarding, crabbing, clamming, boating, and whale watching.There are a few local restaurants and cafes for visitors to enjoy. There's 'The Renfrew Pub' with a waterfront patio. Tomi's Home Cookin' is just a short walk from the property and offers home-style breakfasts and lunches year round. In the Spring, the Coastal Kitchen Cafe and Bridgemans on the Breakwater are other eating places to enjoy local cuisine. The property surrounding the cottage is dotted with forest trails, lookouts and wooden boardwalks. It's also situated right next door to the new Pacific Gateway Marina (the stairs are located at the end of Baird Rd.), making moorage or joining a fish charter easliy accessible.
host_about: I enjoy spending time with family and friends, I love to travel to far off places and I delight in a good glass of wine.  Cheers!

name: Beautiful Luxury Home Bear Mtn Resort Victoria
description:
Our 5 bdrm luxury home is 5 mins walk to the Westin Golf and Spa Resort with Bear Mountain's 36 hole PGA golf course, heated swimming pool and hot tub, rec centre, hiking, biking, tennis, boating, great views, restaurants and dining, family-friendly activities. Perfect for families, groups, business travelers and weddings, anniversaries or special occasions.

You’ll love our place because of the privacy and luxurious comfort, beautiful mountains and an abundance of nature all around you...
neighborhood_overview:
Bear Mountain is a prestigious community and living area and has become a high-demand area to live in. The Bear Mountain Resort is world-renowned for its beautiful surroundings, and two 18 hole golf courses which recently held the PGA Champions Tour in 2016 and again in 2017. The resort has recently (2017) added 8 clay tennis courts that will run year round! They have a mountain biking course also. All of these amenities are usable by guests to Bear Mountain and you can walk up to the resort and inquire at the front desk or in the Pro Shop downstairs as to the cost etc. There are so many hiking and walking trails near the area.

Mountain Market - Mountain Market mini store 45 second drive or a 3 mins walk up the hill that serves a variety of delicious coffees, drinks and home-made sandwiches and a variety of muffins and food as well as quick drink and an assortment of groceries that can fill any gaps in your fridge.

Restaurant 4 mins walk - Jack's Place and Ku
host_about: My wife and I love to travel and when we went to Victoria we fell in love with the weather, city, mountains, the ocean, fresh air, great downtown dining, eateries, pubs, music and the wonderful people!  We decided to purchase our home there so we could enjoy the outdoor beauty, lakes, hiking, golf, ocean, diving, fishing and so much more with family and friends!  The heritage buildings and streets are beautiful and we loved Bear Mountain which is another paradise in itself with so much to do on site. We hope you fall in love with Victoria like we did and that is why we also share our home with you on airbnb.  Life is too short to not see Victoria!

name: Castaway in James Bay, BC!
description:
Castaway in James Bay is a handsome townhouse, just 3 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf, the seafront walkway along the Inner Harbour to downtown & the US Ferries. Restaurants & cafes are at its doorstep. You’ll love its light & tranquility, plus sunny outdoor seating, not to mention two ensuite bathrooms! It is good for adventurers & families.
City of Victoria business licence #00034990.
neighborhood_overview: Fisherman's Wharf is a colourful collection of float homes, and is also home to Barb's Fish and Chips, well-known locally, and loved by all.  There are other choices, such as Mexican, pizza, ice cream, etc.   Right beside the wharf area is a nice park, which is great for visiting dogs.  Upscale hotels on the waterfront are in the same 'hood.  And there's an Italian restaurant right across the street.  And yet, the neighborhood is surprisingly quiet, with the exception of the gulls, and in the summer tour buses taking vacationers back to the cruise ships a 15-minute walk away.  There's even a small church right next door.
host_about: Welcome to James Bay in Victoria, BC!  Originally from Calgary, I worked internationally out of Ottawa for a number of years. I was a teacher in Yukon, Australia and Ethiopia!  On the other 3 continents, I managed international projects. I have family here, Vancouver & Calgary - 6 grand-nephews & nieces. Here's my story, "Six Continents over Five Decades: An Intrepid Woman's Memoir".

name: Poolside on Salt Spring
description: Welcome families! Perched on a ten acre property, this a spacious three bedroom plus den house built for casual leisure. Generous rooms open to sun drenched decks, gardens, and in-ground heated lap pool. The house is artfully decorated creating an ambience of relaxation and tranquility. name: Oakleigh Cottage- Entire House Just for You!
description: You'll feel right at home in our bright and modern carriage house. We offer contactless check-in to your very own private cottage on the edge of the city, nestled under soaring 200 year old oaks in a quiet, central neighborhood- less than 15 minute drive from the hustle and bustle of downtown Victoria and world famous Butchart Gardens! Our open concept cottage boasts vaulted ceilings, skylights, full kitchen, TV, in-suite laundry and free parking- everything needed for a relaxing retreat!
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is quiet with a positive vibe and lots of kids playing in the streets. The house itself is on a small cul-de-sac with ample free parking directly out front.
In terms of location, you'll find you are quite literally right in the middle of some of the best things the region has to offer. Being on the edge of Downtown Victoria means with just a 2 minute drive will be onto the main roads that take you to all the major destinations in the region- no need to cross through town or get out of town first to see the sights!
Across the street is Christmas Hill nature sanctuary, and a 10 minute walk will get you to the top of one of the best 360 degree views of all of Victoria- truly breathtaking and worth the short climb. Continue your hike down the backside of Christmas Hill and you'll find yourself on the boardwalks of Swan Lake Nature Sanctuary.
host_about: Michelle and I are kept busy with our 3 daughters and one large hairy dog! We are an active family and we love good food, the beach, travel, hiking, camping, sports, and time in the garden. Personally, I love building, or rebuilding things (Airstreams, VW, carriage houses, etc). As long time Victoria residents we know lots of hidden areas of the city, so just tell us what you are interested in and we surely have some suggestions!

Welcome to a homey place near Lagoon in Victoria's beautiful Colwood area.
Colwood earned top marks as one of the top 2 safest & best places in BC, the 4th best place in Canada to retire. Spacious place at the cul-de-sac.Quiet, serene setting, beautiful front garden, partially lagoon view.4 bedrooms (2bedrooms are connected) on the 2nd floor with quality beds and open style common area with a equipped kitchen. A saltwater lagoon located at the base of the Royal Roads property, next to the Fort Rodd Hill / Fisgard Lighthouse National Historic Sites and a view across Esquimalt Harbour at Dockyard.

name: Maison de la Mer
description: Beautiful recently renovated waterfront home on quiet cul-de-sac. If privacy and serenity are what you are seeking, you have found the right place. Gentle water access allows you to launch your canoe or kayak from the back of the house. A well appointed home with a level grassy yard. Five minute drive to shopping in Ganges village.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet cul de sac road. Rural setting.
host_about:
Originally from British Columbia, I lived in California for 28 years. Twelve years ago I returned to my homeland on beautiful Salt Spring Island. I maintain a healthy lifestyle and enjoy hosting guests from around the world.  
Gordon and I are avid travellers and we have tried to make our BnB as comfortable as possible, providing all that we can to make guests feel at home. 
The quietude and beauty of our special place is something we never take for granted.
My philosophy of life is to always return to gratitude.

name: Oceanside Townhouse on Sooke Harbour
description: Our beautiful ocean view Townhouse is only a 35 minute drive from Victoria and located at the gateway of the Pacific Marine Circle Route and West Coast Trail. Within steps from your door are fishing charters, whale watching and kayak tours.  Sooke is known for its coastal landscape, local seafood, numerous beaches, rain-forest hikes, zip-lining  and everything in between. Enjoy your morning coffee from one of the balconys soaking up the view.  Let us show you the true splendor of the West Coast!
neighborhood_overview: Sooke is a beautiful seaside town that offers great restaurants, spas and shopping just steps away from the ocean.  Our Townhouse is walking distance to the town core along with being right around the corner from a spa, water sport rentals and restaurants.
host_about:
With 20 years in the tourism and hospitality industry, I have enjoyed accommodating the needs of clients and guests. With the main focus on customer service and making their trip a memorable one. I am a mother of 3 and am an explorer at heart who loves adventuring with family, friends and of course our pooch.
Whether this is your first time to Sooke (you're in for a treat!) or you're a frequent visitor, it is my mission to make your stay a wonderful one!

description: Gorgeous ocean suite located just 45 minutes from Victoria.  The perfect base to explore Canada's South Pacific... hiking, beach combing, Victoria, Pedder Bay, kayaking, Whiffin Spit, storm watching, Hatley Castle, Butchart Gardens and more!  Here you can relax, recharge, unwind and enjoy all of the wonders of Southern VI.  Private suite with full kitchen, bathroom, own entrance, covered deck, bbq, wood fireplace & hot-tub. After retiring from 12 years owning & operating a successful fishing lodge I have now set my sights on this gorgeous spot and vacation rental here in SPECTACULAR  East Sooke!  Where Victoria meets the Wild West Coast.  Assisting me with this new venture is my handsome son Colton and our useless bulldogs Hank and Hazel.  
We are really looking forward to  meeting new friends through Black Otter Cove!!

name: Cat and Pumpkin Executive Cottage: a dreamy escape
description: Executive-style nature lover's retreat on a mountain ridge estate. Forested setting. Very private, clean, comfortable, well-appointed & upscale cabin for a care-free, enjoyable stay. Private trails, breathtaking sunrises; panoramic ocean, mountain, valley & star-studded sky views. Eagles soar by at eye-level. Perfect getaway for calm, inspiration, regeneration.  Feel what it means to be on Salt Spring.  Focused on stays in compliance with Islands Trust bylaw 355; all enquiries welcome!
neighborhood_overview:
Far away from it all, yet so close. Very private, resort-like, forested property that is a 10-minute drive to town, walkable distance to warm-water swimming at Cusheon Lake, and a short drive to the beach at Beddis Beach and Fulford Harbour. Farm stands nearby, as are walking trails, Ruckle Park, Salt Spring Island Cheese, artist studios.

For more photos and videos of the property and Salt Spring Island in general, please visit my Instagram account at olga. szkabarnicki.art
host_about:
After practising Aboriginal law for 20 years, Olga now pursues a full-time artistic practice, with a particular interest in the human figure and dance movement.  Lawrence is an avid gardener with a passion for philosophy, bonsai trees, and sailing.  

We love living on Salt Spring Island, surrounded by temperate rainforest and immersed in a cultural community like no other.  We enjoy the peacefulness of our property, where we also enjoy good food, wine, and good company; fresh bread, Argentinian tango, gardening, bird watching, yoga, and chasing deer away from the roses (feel free to assist).  Welcoming to all, and truly appreciative of diversity!

We are happy to provide recommendations for the many wonderful activities, markets, farm stands, festivals, foodie-haunts, beaches, and parks that our beautiful island has to offer.  As our guest, you will enjoy privacy and tranquility in a fully equipped cottage located in its own garden, secluded from signs of civilization (such as they are on Salt Spring Island).  You are welcome to walk the many paths and trails throughout our 25 acre parcel of paradise, exploring rainforest, meadow, ponds, and cultivated gardens.  The paths connect to public trails, so you can literally walk or hike the whole day long without leaving home!
