name: Quiet Luxury 'Oasis at The Falls' in Downtown
description: Gorgeous south-facing condo {'Oasis at the Falls'}, 7th floor,  in the Falls: a short walk from both the Inner Harbour & Beacon Hill Park in downtown Victoria.  It is only steps away to everything Victoria has to offer!  It is a spacious 1100 square foot light filled condominium. This is an urban lifestyle gem and you are sure to enjoy this quiet oasis in the middle of the vibrant city of Victoria, British Columbia! Luxury resort living with all of the comforts of home. WiFi 5G no device limit
neighborhood_overview:
The Falls condo building is nestled within a few minutes’ walk to:
- Shopping including boutique stores
- Victoria Conference Centre
- Arts and entertainment district of Victoria
- The world famous Empress Hotel
- Victoria’s Inner harbour (harbour flights, boat tours, whale watching and cruise ships close by)
- Beacon Hill Park and Petting Goat Zoo
- Fisherman's Wharf and Float Homes
- Sightseeing bus tours
- Museums (including the Royal Museum and IMAX theatre)
- Dozens of restaurants and pubs including fine dining
- Souvenir shops
- Kids activities/entertainment
- The British Columbia legislature buildings
- Bustling coffee shops
- Spas
- Tourist attractions (hiking, biking, kayaking and much more within a short walk or drive)
- Movie theaters
- Exciting nightlife
- Markets and more!
host_about:
I love to travel and over the years have come to realize what comforts I and other guests would enjoy while staying away from home. It is great to stay someplace that feels comfortable, is clean, bright, airy, has all the modern amenities, and that you can just relax in the evenings enjoying a book, watching TV, surfing the internet or watching Netflix on our Smart TV’s (3-55 inch Samsung HD 4K Curved Smart TV's!) and as well simply enjoying the company of the other guests you are with.

I have tried to emulate this in our Oasis at the Falls. If you decide to book our condo we hope you enjoy the Victoria scrapbook of: local restaurants, pubs, attractions, tours to take, shopping close by, hiking areas, parks and many more items. Feel free to add yours in the guest book so that other guests are able to see what other items to do in and around Victoria!

name: Marigold Family Haven
description: Family home on corner lot of a dead end street. Complete with backyard, bbq, deck that looks out over yard, bins of lego, balls and nets, and a block away from biking trail. 20 minute commute to downtown or ferries. 5 minute drive to access island highway.
host_about:
I am a counsellor and native Victorian. My wife teaches grade 1. We have three spirited kids and work hard to keep them active and engaged. We have lived in this home for the past 16 years and renovated and expanded it 12 years ago. We love the neighbourhood and the central location. 

We love to read, travel, ride bikes, play soccer and hockey, and sample the great food choices in Victoria.

In the summer, one of our favourite things to do is head up to a small local lake for a swim.

name: Captain Jack's Subsea Retreat   Families & Groups!
description:
A beautiful Pan Abode cedar log house with a fire place, three dining areas; 2 inside and deck, and non-exclusive use of our heated pool (May 15 through 10 Oct) and gardens. Hot Tub year round.
Let Pam and Jack introduce you to the best the west coast can offer...on land and on or under water.
Jack and Pamela have a suite with separate entrance into the house and do most of the care taking.
We welcome families and respectful groups.
There is an additional listing for a cottage.
neighborhood_overview:
Soak in the culture of our neighborhood here in Deep Cove. Drop in
to the ‘honour store’ at Smyth’s Farm for fresh grown produce and
homemade jams – just up the road from PJ's. Then visit the Deep
Cove Market for delicious fare from local growers and makers, perfect for
grabbing snacks on the go or preparing a meal at the house. Make sure
to stop along the roadside and pick some fresh blackberries!
Hike John Dean Provincial Park to Pickles’ Bluff. Explore a pristine old growth forest and panoramic views just minutes from town.
Wander the shops and waterfront of Beacon Avenue, and grab the best coffee in town at Quince Café… Experience The Roost farm café and bakery for lunch. All ingredients used are from the farm/orchards and vineyard. Sit out on the patio and enjoy the sunshine or heaters on a cool day. Taste some locally made, award-winning ciders at Sea Cider Orchard.
On Thursday nights Beacon Avenue comes alive with the Sidney Stre
host_about:
Professional Dive Instructor/Boat Operator/Equipment Technician since mid 1970 +
Expects to train at least 10,000 divers before retiring (9020 + and counting).
Charters and Expeditions worldwide.

name: Tranquil Oak Bay Home near Willows Beach (GST inc)
description: Best neighborhood in Victoria. Two complete suites in a 3-story character home. Willows Beach, tennis courts, parks, rec centre, banks and restaurants , all within 10 minutes walking. Bus stop is 100m from house and 10 minute ride to the city centre or UVIC . Two floor suite with 3 bedrooms; 1 queen bed and 2 bedrooms w/ twin over double bunk beds. 2 bath rooms, laundry, fully equipped kitchen and dishwasher. Second suite is a walk-in with kitchen, living area, queen bedroom, bathroom, and bath.
neighborhood_overview: The safe and affluent Village of Oak Bay is the most desirable neighbourhood in greater Victoria. Surrounded by ocean on two sides there is only local traffic and travelling to downtown with a car takes less than ten minutes. Three unique villages are filled with fine food purveyors and boutique shops. There are many wonderful walks in the back lanes, sea-side beaches and trails.
host_about: Part time dad of two wonderful tweens living the life in beautiful Victoria. Retired chef now working as researcher with the Canadian Forest Service. Avid gardener and intrepid outdoor adventurer. The mountains and the ocean  feed my soul.

description:
Please inquire for availability before booking, calendar not up todate.

2 bedroom, sleeps 6 people beautiful luxurious ocean view resort.
Outdoor lap pool
· Outdoor hot tub

neighborhood_overview:
Greetings from Victoria, British Columbia, on beautiful Vancouver Island. Spend your days strolling through the world-famous Butchart Gardens, sipping tea at the Empress Hotel or shopping along Government Street. WorldMark Victoria is positioned at the edge of the inner harbor ? the perfect location for watching the water or setting out to explore Victoria's many attractions.

WorldMark Victoria consists of 92 two- and three-bedroom units, as well as two-bedroom penthouses, all with a fully equipped kitchen, balcony and at least a partial view of the harbor. Due to the resort's proximity to the harbor, you may notice some boat and plane noise during busier parts of the day. ResortNet 2, WorldMark's wireless Internet service, is available in all units for a small fee.

WorldMark Victoria is happy to provide elevators as well as an outdoor lap pool, outdoor children's pool, outdoor hot tub and a fitness center. One underground parking spot per unit is available for ve
host_about:
Like you, I love to travel, including cruising. I love to help people. I love to be hospitable. I love to read, especially about the places I am about to visit in my travels and adventures.  My husband and I have visited most of the European countries, north and south, as well as: Turkey, Israel, Greece. Southeast Asia, and the Western Rockies of the United States and Western Canada. We have also visited the western shores of South America.

"What you know is a function of whom you choose to believe." This is my husband's (Ph.D.) saying. Of course, I believe it.

I just retired after thirty (30) years with one company. Now, I am enjoying sharing our  luxurious vacation resort (which has properties around the world and within the USA). Name any place on this globe, and I will try to help you make your dream vacation or travel experience come true. 

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Thank you,

Lorie

name: Specialty Care Retreat - Loving Earth Living Sky
description: Beautiful retreat suite on peaceful, sunny, SSI Paradise property! A truly loving space!  Additional care options for those with special needs, disabilities, injuries, seniors etc.  Luggage & parking assistance, laundry services, personal care and/or assistance, 24 hr on-call care.  Veg./vegan meals/Live Raw Juices available upon request with some additional cost.  Pro. Healing sessions avail. Contact us for a full listing of services/costs & to personalize/book your stay.  Gratitude and peace!
neighborhood_overview: Quiet cul-de-sac  (no through traffic) with access to forest walking trails.  1.2 km to wonderful lake access and swimming.  Good People.  Peaceful and Serene.  Central to all amenities on the island.  Close driving access to beautiful ocean beaches and several fresh water lakes!
host_about: Hi, my name is Etienne.  I invite you to stay at Loving Earth Living Sky Retreat on Salt Spring Island where, along with my loving family, I offer you the best quality care during your stay.  We have together over 37 years experience offering care to individuals with special needs of all kinds; injuries, disabilities both physical and cognitive, seniors, those with illness, and those on a spiritual &/or  physical healing journey.  Our retreat is a sanctuary of solace, peace and healing.  I am a compassionate and gifted healer who is patient and empathic.  I love hiking in nature, gardening, being active outdoors, spending time with my family and being of service to others.  Contact me and we can speak further!

name: Fabulous Penthouse Loft in Heart of Victoria
description:
Experience the sights and sounds of historical Victoria in this top-floor 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom loft located in downtown Victoria's Chinatown District.

Filled with beautiful natural lighting from the many expansive windows, choice décor and high-end finishing touches throughout. Within blocks of The Parliament Buildings, The Inner Harbour, The Royal BC Museum, The Empress Hotel & more! 1 secure underground parking stall is included.

*** This rental requires 90 days minimum.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment has a walk score of 99% which shows you how central we are. Unique shops and restaurants make this a great place to gather with friends & family or take care of business meetings. The Upper Harbour is only two blocks down the street and the Inner Harbour, The Parliament Buildings, The Empress Hotel and The Royal Museum are just a 10-minute stroll away. Maps and guides will be available in the apartment upon arrival.

If you have any questions or would like any recommendations, I am more than happy to help!
host_about:
Hey there, I’m Dan!

I love traveling to new cities/countries, and meeting new people. Most of my weekends are spent rock climbing, camping or skiing.

Traveling to different places has made me appreciate the importance of a welcoming host or helpful locals! I am eager to return the favor, and make your time in our beautiful city all the more enjoyable!

Feel free to contact me with any questions about my listings anytime. Happy and safe travels!

name: Cottage on the Bluff
description: The cottage is perfectly situated on the bluff of Otterbay, Pender Island.  With an unobstructed view of the Pacific, it immediately sets the tone for the days ahead.  An open vaulted living room with an adjoining kitchen creates an ultimate space to spend time.   The outside gives you an opportunity for outdoor living  with a  wrap around deck, sun umbrella and patio furniture.
neighborhood_overview:
Pender Island is one of the Southern Gulf Islands most beautiful.

Pender offers lovely waterfront parks, rolling countryside perfect for cycling, a lively arts scene, and a full slate of water activities.

Factor in good dining & several spas, and and it's no wonder this island gem is popular with stressed out urbanites.

(as written in Pender Island tourism)
host_about: Although I love the West Coast of BC and spend most of my time between our homes in Vancouver, Whistler and Pender Island....I am a lover of travel.    My heart resides in Italy, my feet amongst the sand in Mexico and my mind wherever travel opportunities bring me.   I am passionate about fitness, the outdoors, good food and the gather of friends and family.    Anytime I can share my experiences &  passions of life, I do so willingly.  Hence, why I want to share our cottage on Pender with you.

From the living room the bay doors open to a deck that spans the length of the suite and looks out on Blue Heron Basin in Tsehum Harbour.

name: Solitude at Sandcut, a true west coast experience.
description: Towered by giant trees, our cozy cabin sits in solitude on the craggy bluff at the south end of Sandcut beach.  An hour from Victoria and minutes from the surf at Jordan River this custom built cedar cabin features an incredible master bedroom, a sunken living room with a granite fireplace, a cute galley kitchen and a big oceanfront patio from which you can often see eagles, otters, seals and sometimes even whales.  Explore the nearby beaches, trails and waterfalls or try great local foods.
neighborhood_overview: You are less than two minutes from the surf at Jordan river by drive but you can actually walk all the way there along the beach at low tide.   The property also has another beach only accessible through our property to the south making it exclusively for our guests.
host_about: Originally from Ontario I moved to Victoria 20 years ago and now work as a Realtor at Fair Realty.   Always looking for opportunity and interesting experiences I like spending down time at the dog park, getting some exercise or reading a book.   If you have any questions at all about where to go and what to see I would love to send you some links.

name: Cute As A Button Beach House
description:
The BBQ is back!!

Adorable cozy beach house with a big heart. Quiet & friendly neighbourhood. Steps from amazing sunny-all-day, sandy beach. Kayaking, horse riding, golf, farmers market, yoga, biking & hiking, all in the vicinity. Or just relax on the sun deck, waking up to the sound of the waves and birds singing - ahh, such peace! Perfectly situated for accessing Regional and Provincial parks in every direction. Flooded with beautiful natural light. 35 min to downtown, airport & ferries.
neighborhood_overview:
A great little community, super friendly, on a road that ends at the beach, so very quiet, just the sounds of the waves and nature. Literally steps away from the beautiful sandy beach - a well kept secret in the Victoria area.
Close by (a short drive) is fresh waterlake swimming (Matheison Lake) and unlimited fantastic hiking. So many beaches and parks nearby, a marina for fishing boat rental, farmers markets, artisans, farm stands with fresh produce, horse riding and more!
Further afield, but not that far, (12 min by car), are the towns of Langford and Colwood, (collectively called Westhills) with all the regular amenities of shopping centres, restaurants and sports facilities.
Downtown Victoria is just a 30 minute drive away, and the airport and ferry terminal about 45 minute drive.
host_about: I love creating an inviting and comfortable environment that inspires, rejuvenates and soothes the soul. My background is in Art, Music and Design, and raising 3 girls as a single mom, practicality and functionality are key too.

name: Luxurious Victoria Condo - 2bed/2bath
description:
Victoria is a sophisticated gem of timeless quality, named for one of history’s most remarkable women. With a temperate climate and British Colonial heritage, Victoria is a perfect destination year-round. Sights include the world-famous Butchart Gardens, Royal British Columbia Museum and the amazing Victoria Butterfly Gardens.

Two Bedroom: Queen in master, twins in second bedroom, queen murphy bed in living area. Maximum occupancy 6.
neighborhood_overview:
Popular Attractions
The Butchart Gardens
Located on an expansive country estate, the 55-acre gardens feature floral displays, meandering paths and expansive lawns. 15 mi.

Royal BC Museum and IMAX Theatre
Learn about the human and natural history of British Columbia through exciting exhibits at the Royal BC Museum. The museum also features the 400-seat National Geographic IMAX Theatre, which has five different 45-minute films showing daily. ¾ mi.

Victoria Bug Zoo
A visit to this must see zoo offers visitors an excellent opportunity to view and experience multi-legged creatures from around the world in a safe, fun and friendly atmosphere. 1 1/2 miles.

Annual Festivals
February: Victoria Film Festival, Victoria Tea Festival

April: Victoria Performing Arts Festival

May:Uno Festival, Victoria Highland Games

June: Jazzfest

July: Ska Festival, Taste: Festival of Food and Wine, Busker Festiva
host_about:
Hello there! 

Thank you for visiting my host profile!

I am the co-founder of Sharebnb Rentals. I am a full-time podcaster and short-term rental operator living in The Lone Star State. I love reading, working out, and spending whatever free time I have with my family.  

Through the Airbnb hosting endeavor, I aim to provide the best possible experience to all visitors through excellent service and quality local recommendations! Nothing is more reassuring and calming than finding a place that feels like a second home on your travels.

Feel free to book or message me first; I am friendly, outgoing, and happy to answer any specific questions in advance.

Experience Little Rock & Dallas with me!  

Hope to host you soon!

Our secluded Cottage and Bunkhouse sleeps up to 6 guests, featuring a new private covered hot tub, propane fire pit, covered gas BBQ, one bedroom, plus a queen sized sofa bed, in the Cottage, and two single beds in the Bunkhouse, a fully equipped kitchen, gas heater and a large deck with spectacular ocean, mountain and forest views. name: The Sanctuary: Treetop Living
description:
Welcome to our Sanctuary in the trees!

Perched high atop Ganges Harbour, nestled among the trees, you will find your special sanctuary. After a quiet & peaceful nights sleep, awake refreshed in the serenity of the forest surrounded by natural light and forest scents.

Situated on 4 acres, our home is totally private, yet only a 3-minute drive to Ganges. Peaceful and tranquil, come here to relax after a full day of exploring.
neighborhood_overview:
Yoga
Just two houses away you will find The Nest Yoga Studio. Practice with the warmth of a wood-burning stove and an amazing view! Book a private Hot Yoga class for 2, or for larger groups Sarah Jane can lead a yoga class on the deck here, weather depending. Inquire about availability.


There is a multitude of lakes and hiking paths that will captivate your mind. The Salish Seas will calm you as the forest groves full of lush undergrowth, filled with ferns and big leaf maple encapsulate your soul.

3 mins drive to Ganges town centre.
10 mins to Long Harbour/Fulford.
23 minutes walking to Ganges (through trails, if you like!)
20 mins drive to Ruckle Provincial park
20 mins drive to Mt. Maxwell Provincial Park
host_about:
Hello fellow Airbnbers!

I'm Kelly, I love learning foreign languages and exploring new places. My passion is hospitality and I take pride in providing the very best service to my guests. I especially enjoy meeting people from all over the world !

If there’s anything I can do to make your stay more enjoyable, please don’t hesitate to get in touch.

I hope you will enjoy my home on Salt Spring as much as I do :)

name: Gorgeous House, Low Bank Beachfront, Brooks Point
description: Watch orcas swim by as you enjoy your morning coffee on the large stone deck. Other great wildlife viewing includes seals, porpoises, otters, eagles, mink, deer. Gorgeous ocean views from all south-facing windows.  Steps out the back door to the pebble beach. Kids will enjoy beach combing and exploring tidal pools full of starfish, hermit crabs, sea cucumbers and more!
neighborhood_overview: 5 minute drive to Poet's Cove Resort, with a full service spa, restaurants, pub, public swimming pool, playground. Rent a kayak or canoe on your own, or book a tour through Poet's Cove Marina.

name: Galiano Island Home by the Sea
description:
From the house or deck watch eagles, seals, porpoises and sea lions fishing, and occasional Orcas passing by. Sunsets are spectacular as the sun goes down over the water and mountains.

House is on the edge of the cliff and deck allows you to look straight down to the water.

Rooms are spacious, with 3 having sea views and one with a garden view.

Underfloor heating throughout house.

High cliff so may not be suitable for small children.

Large parking area. Three cars.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is situated in the quiet north end of the island. It’s a 5 minute walk to Spanish Hill Dock and a cove for a quick swim .

Public beach access locations are available islandwide. There are two of these within walking distance from the house. The closest one is about 300 meters from the house on Deacon lane.

Galiano Island offers lots of hiking trails, beaches and kayaking.
Bodega ridge hiking. Mount Galiano hike. Dionisio beach hike. These three are a must if you enjoy nature and hiking.

Kayak and motorcycle rentals are available at Montague harbour.

name: Great family home close to Oak Bay village
description:
Bright, tastefully renovated character house close to Oak Bay village, beaches and downtown. The house has a sunny, private west facing backyard with a large deck off the kitchen. Private East facing porch off the front of the house to enjoy coffee in the morning sun. Open concept living room, dining room and kitchen provides lots of space for the whole family.
Due to the coronavirus, we’re taking extra care to disinfect frequently touched surfaces between reservations.
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located on a quiet, family-friendly street, across the street from an elementary school playground. There is an abundance of great coffee shops, restaurants, and grocery stores to choose from, all within minutes by foot or car.

name: Salt Spring Island - 2BDRM/2BATH - Mariner's Loft
description:
Welcome to unit 201 - this beautiful 2 bedroom apartment just minutes walk to Ganges. . This beautiful space offers 2 bedrooms, one with a king and one queen size beds. A pullout sofabed in the living room as well. Two full bathrooms. The space has a flat screen tv, fireplace, washer/dryer, balcony with BBQ and patio set, full kitchen & bar, dining for 6 & indoor gas fireplace. The best rates are always available by booking directly on our website.

All units are absolutely non-smoking.
neighborhood_overview: This space offers spectacular views of Ganges Harbour with all the amazing offerings on Salt Spring within walking distance. neighborhood_overview:
Our charming Airbnb is centrally located in downtown Victoria and easy walking distance to all the major attractions:

1. Chinatown - Explore shops, savor food, and experience a rich cultural atmosphere. (8-min walk)

2. Market Square - One of Victoria's most unique shopping areas, mixed of over 30 retailers consisting of one-of-a-kind boutiques, restaurants, and services (8-min walk)

3. The Bay Centre - For shopping enthusiasts, The Bay Centre is just a short walk away, offering a variety of retail stores (8-min walk)

4. Miniature World - View detailed dioramas with historical and fantasy scenes. (12-min walk)

5. Royal BC Museum - Discover BC's history, culture, and nature. (15-min walk)

6. High Tea at the Empress Hotel - Experience elegance over tea at Victoria's iconic Empress Hotel (15-min walk)

7. Whale Watching (Prince of Whales Whale & Marine) - See Vancouver Island’s massive marine creatures in action (1

name: Luxurious Victoria Condo - 2bed/2bath Queen
description:
Victoria is a sophisticated gem of timeless quality, named for one of history’s most remarkable women. With a temperate climate and British Colonial heritage, Victoria is a perfect destination year-round. Sights include the world-famous Butchart Gardens, Royal British Columbia Museum and the amazing Victoria Butterfly Gardens.

Two Bedroom Queen: Queen in master, queen in second bedroom, queen murphy bed in living area. Maximum occupancy 6.
neighborhood_overview:
Popular Attractions
The Butchart Gardens
Located on an expansive country estate, the 55-acre gardens feature floral displays, meandering paths and expansive lawns. 15 mi.

Royal BC Museum and IMAX Theatre
Learn about the human and natural history of British Columbia through exciting exhibits at the Royal BC Museum. The museum also features the 400-seat National Geographic IMAX Theatre, which has five different 45-minute films showing daily. ¾ mi.

Victoria Bug Zoo
A visit to this must see zoo offers visitors an excellent opportunity to view and experience multi-legged creatures from around the world in a safe, fun and friendly atmosphere. 1 1/2 miles.

Annual Festivals
February: Victoria Film Festival, Victoria Tea Festival

April: Victoria Performing Arts Festival

May:Uno Festival, Victoria Highland Games

June: Jazzfest

July: Ska Festival, Taste: Festival of Food and Wine, Busker Festiva
host_about:
Hello there! 

Thank you for visiting my host profile!

I am the co-founder of Sharebnb Rentals. I am a full-time podcaster and short-term rental operator living in The Lone Star State. I love reading, working out, and spending whatever free time I have with my family.  

Through the Airbnb hosting endeavor, I aim to provide the best possible experience to all visitors through excellent service and quality local recommendations! Nothing is more reassuring and calming than finding a place that feels like a second home on your travels.

Feel free to book or message me first; I am friendly, outgoing, and happy to answer any specific questions in advance.

Experience Little Rock & Dallas with me!  

Hope to host you soon!

host_about:
Born and raise on Vancouver Island, my first job was already in the hospitality business. I started career with the Banff Springs Hotel in my early 20's. I then worked at the Gastof Post Hotel in Lech, Austria, a small town in the Arlberg ski region. A few years later, I opened  Peaks Lodge, a mountain retreat and restaurant in Revelstoke, BC. I spent 10 years taking guests into the back-country on skiing and snowmobile tours. My strong passion for the ocean brought me back to the Island. I then decided  to open The Corbett Guest Suites and Adventures where I chose to bring fun and work together. Sharing my favorite hobbies with the house guests, activities such as bicycling, sailing, kayaking, fishing and crabbing are offered to anyone interested. Many other attractions and services are available in the near by area. I strive to ensure that my guests have a wonderful stay at the Corbett Guest Suites and an exciting visit to our beautiful town, “Sidney by the Sea.” 
Looking forward to meet new comers or welcoming back regulars!

name: Downtown Two Bedroom Apartment.
description:
Located in downtown Victoria BC, at the base of Chinatown, the Swans Hotel building was built in 1913. At that time, the area was a hotbed of secret societies, underground activity, and a liquor distillery.

Today, while shaped by our colourful history, our neighbourhood is welcoming for tourists from near and far. Swans Hotel has been restored as a 31 room boutique hotel with much of the original brick and wood beams featured throughout the suites.
neighborhood_overview: Swans is located across from the inner harbour in downtown Victoria. Between the  famous brewery district and the lovely Chinatown, you won't be disappointed. Great restaurants, shopping and plenty of walking paths surround Swans.

description: Private entrance to 2 story 1908 Arts and Crafts home. Willows Beach, tennis courts, parks, rec centre, liquor store, banks and restaurants within 6 -10 minutes walking in 3 unique villages. Bus stop is 100m from house and 10 minute ride to the city centre or UVIC . Three guest bedrooms; 1 queen bed w/ box spring and 2 twin over double  bunk beds. Two bathrooms, laundry, fully equipped kitchen and dishwasher. Large decks  at front and back.
neighborhood_overview: The safe and affluent Village of Oak Bay is the most desirable neighbourhood in greater Victoria. Surrounded by ocean on two sides there is only local traffic and travelling to downtown with a car takes less than ten minutes. Three unique villages are filled with fine food purveyors and boutique shops. There are many wonderful walks in the back lanes, sea-side beaches and trails.
host_about: Part time dad of two wonderful tweens living the life in beautiful Victoria. Retired chef now working as researcher with the Canadian Forest Service. Avid gardener and intrepid outdoor adventurer. The mountains and the ocean  feed my soul.

Three Bedroom: Queen in master, queen in second, twins in third bedroom, queen murphy bed in living area. Max Occ 8.
neighborhood_overview:
Victoria is a sophisticated gem of timeless quality, named for one of history’s most remarkable women. With a temperate climate and British Colonial heritage, Victoria is a perfect destination year-round. Sights include the world-famous Butchart Gardens, Royal British Columbia Museum and the amazing Victoria Butterfly Gardens. Stroll through Goldstream park where salmon spawn, eagles fly and waterfalls cascade down cliffs. After a full day, head back to the resort to linger over tea. The rooms are angled to maximize water views, and the fireplace will keep you cozy as you look out over the moonlit bay.

Popular Attractions
The Butchart Gardens
Located on an expansive country estate, the 55-acre gardens feature floral displays, meandering paths and expansive lawns. 15 mi.

Royal BC Museum and IMAX Theatre
Learn about the human and natural history of British Columbia through exciting exhibits at the Royal BC Museum. The museum also features the 400-seat

name: Shangrila Oceanfront Vacation home (entire floor)
description:
Situated at the highest point of Pender Island exclusive Oaks Bluff, offering unparalleled 360-degree Ocean views, surrounded by 10 Acres of private natural surroundings .
The entire floor is more than 2000 Square feet, including 4 suites with a bathroom in each suite. large living room, kitchen, fireplaces, sound system, surround patios, BBQ, indoor and outdoor dining area.

Everything you require in a home is supplied to make your vacation memorable.
neighborhood_overview:
Pender Island offers lovely waterfront parks, rolling countryside perfect for cycling or hiking, nature trails, nine hole golf course and a 27-hole frisbee golf course, a lively arts scene, a winery, restaurants, spas, many public beach access points, boat excursions, fishing trips and much more.
For your safety, security and convenience there is a medical clinic, fire department, police office, emergency helicopter landing pad, ambulance, taxi service.
The nearby Driftwood Center offers a grocery store, bakery, pharmacy, liquor store, gift shop, post office, bank, hair salon, restaurant, Saturday Farmers Market and more.
For more information,please check:
http://penderisland.info
http://penderislandchamber.com
http://shangrilabnb.ca

name: Willows Beach House
description: Beautiful rancher style home in the heart of Oak Bay.  This home is just a few blocks from Willows Beach and Estevan Village.  It is perfectly located with everything within walking distance. This is the perfect home for families or friends wanting to relax and spend time together.
neighborhood_overview:
- Oak Bay Village is a 10 minute walk away where you will find many restaurants, coffee shops and grocery stores.
- Downtown Victoria is a 7 minute drive or there is a bus stop just around the corner that will take you there.
- Oak Bay Recreation Centre is a 5 minute walk (Skating rink, swimming pool and other amenities).
- Many other beaches within a 15 minute drive.
- University of Victoria is a 6 minute drive.

name: West Coast Style House. Ten Min To Donwtown
description:
Recline on the patio sofa while the gas and charcoal BBQ gets to work, before eating in the shaded dining area. The interior is in Modern West Coast style, with yellow accents in the living room perfectly complementing the plentiful natural light.

Main floor includes a full kitchen/family area with air conditioning, an island bar with seating for 2, plus, a small table with 2 chairs. Also, in this area is a large L-shaped couch, swivel sofa chair along with a large screen TV. Just off the kitchen/family area through the french doors is the main dining area, with a large dining table for 6 people. Beyond this, you will find the formal sitting area with 2 large sofas and 2 swivel rockers.
The laundry room, a full bathroom and one bedroom are also located on this floor.
Off the kitchen/family area you have access to a large 2 teared deck. The west facing deck is complete with a gas/charcoal BBQ, a patio dinning table for 6 and patio sofa set for your outdoor enjoymen
neighborhood_overview:
Just down the street is the Shelborne shopping center, which also has a good selection of restaurants.
Mount Tolmie Park is only steps away, and has trails, picnic areas and panoramic city and ocean views, while Horner Park is very child-friendly.
host_about:
Hi my name is Barbara I am from Venezuela, my husband Barry is from Canada and we have two fantastic children. Having recently moved to Victoria after living abroad for many years, our love of travel has taken us on journey's in many countries and has given us a better understanding of the diverse cultures in our world. 
My favorite destinations so far have been New York, Patagonia, Margarita Island, Rome and I have to admit that I am in love with Victoria BC. This city has so much to offer! I am fascinated with the architecture of the houses, it is a pleasure just to drive around and see the different styles of houses in the many different neighbourhoods. 
As you know we are surrounded by the ocean and we are ocean goers! We love to spend time aboard our boat exploring the Gulf Islands, crab, salmon fishing, or just relaxing on some remote beach as the kids paddle their kayak. Summers here on the island are magical! 
One of my passions is interior design, this combined with Barry's creativity and skills we have managed to create this little oasis in the middle of the city. 
As hosts we are pleased to offer our Airbnb "Luxury Studio Apartment" and hope that we reflect within the suite, those little things (lessons learned in our travels), that will make your stay a comfortable and memorable experience!

name: #33 Gladstone
description:
Welcome to the beautiful Victoria, BC!

Greeting you upon your arrival will be a fully equipped upper suite with three cozy bedrooms, a large living room for relaxing, a bright kitchen for cooking and a delightful back yard and patio, set-up with a BBQ for your tasty meals, but that is not all folks!

You also find yourself in walking distance of the most thrilling amenities Fernwood offers, such as: the Belfry Theatre, The Fernwood Inn, The Cornerstone Cafe, and the She Said Gallery.
neighborhood_overview:
This two bedroom suite in the heart of Victoria has, a full kitchen, living room, laundry facilities. A large backyard with BBQ and patio set is ideal for warm summer nights. Off street parking and a private entrance are included for your convenience.

You also find yourself in walking distance of the most thrilling amenities Fernwood offers, such as: the Belfry Theatre, The Fernwood Inn, The Cornerstone Cafe, and the She Said Gallery.

This dynamic urban village also boasts: the Ça Va Bistro Moderne as well as the Stage Wine Bar, which has been identified by ENROUTE Magazine as one of the top 10 new restaurants in Canada.

Other services available in your area include: Studio 1313 Hair Salon, The Yoga Den, Soma Active Health, Gothic A.E. Piercing Salon with Nail Haven, Tonic Spa-tique, Fly the Cage Tattoo Studio, Who-Dyd-Your-Hair, The Paint Box School of Art, Aubergine Specialty Foods, Freedom Kilt and the Templed Mind Studio Gallery.

name: Upscale Character Home with Luxurious Amenities
description: The best of Victoria's character home charm and modern west coast living style by Swan Lake. This separate Lower Level home is bright, airy space with 9 foot ceilings; large bedrooms with walk in closets; all while affording an open concept. Beautiful wide hallways with wainscoting, crown molding, and curved arches. A focal feature of this home is the floor to ceiling rock-faced fireplace, finished with a live edge mantel. The kitchen boasts premium SS appliances perfect for the avid home chef.
neighborhood_overview: Centrally located between downtown, ferries, and YYJ airport yet tucked away in the blissfully quiet neighbourhood of Swan Lake with stunning views! With a nature reserve directly across the street, there is no shortage of beautiful wildlife including humming birds, deer, and bunnies; leaving one feeling at home in a true nature sanctuary. Located only minutes by car or bike to Elk and Beaver lake, 10 -12 minutes from Thetis lake, 15 minutes to the airport, 20 minutes to the ferry and only 10 minutes to downtown in the busiest traffic we have. A perfect and ideal location to enjoy nature, the city and when ready to get away from the noise, hustle and bustle of downtown Victoria,  you will enjoy the space to sit back and relax.
host_about: Longtime resident of #YYJ, Real Estate Professional with Re/Max Camosun for 30 years. Be it vacation rentals, long term rentals or finding your forever home; thoughtful homes is what I do best. As a DIY/HGTV enthusiast, attention to detail and well thought out living spaces are important to me. I am an avid outdoorsman, enjoy home cooking but also cycling, running, triathlons including the Iron Man (5x), coming 34th I(AG) at World Championship in Kona. Working and chatting with all types of people is in my nature, please feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns.

name: NEW - Hilltop Double-A Frame with Sea Views
description:
Peek-a-boo sea views from this unique double-A-Frame cedar home - a luxury hilltop hideaway on beautiful Galiano Island. Three well-appointed bedrooms, plus downstairs guest room w/comfortable pull-out sofa and adjoining office and private balcony.

Fully-equipped kitchen opens to wraparound deck with Weber bbq, comfy outdoor sectional and set up for outdoor dining in the warm weather. Inside, the farmhouse table seats 8, and living room has two oversized sofas with additional luxe seating.
neighborhood_overview: A serene, windy, hilltop road surrounded by other cottages, and some permanent residences with lots of privacy.
host_about:
I'm both an Airbnb host and a traveller, with dual Canadian and EU citizenship, and mother to a 6-year old with dual Canadian and American citizenship. We live in Vancouver, British Columbia, spend time at our cottage on Galiano Island which is also a 5-star Airbnb. We love to travel the world and immerse ourselves in the local scene. 

I am also a marketing executive in the advertising industry, and a former radio broadcaster.  Music, dance, food, books, theatre, all play big roles in this life, and I've always got a side-project going on...

name: Happy Bright 2 Bdrm Suite
description: Welcome to this family friendly, tree-lined street, with groceries/amenities - easy 2 min walk. This bright suite w private entrance offers a cute patio that leads to a fenced yard w large trampoline. Your stay is super comfy: 1st bdrm has Qn bed w desk & cable TV; 2nd bdrm has Qn bed w desk. LR offers a new comfy sofa-bed w 47" cable & AppleTV & third desk. Spacious bthrm with tub/shower. Full kitchen. Laundry in suite. We live upstairs with our kids and look forward to hosting you.
neighborhood_overview: Honestly our neighbourhood is amazing. Its tree lined with a green space with walking trails only 1 minute from our house. Groceries or ice cream treats are a short walk away. It will take you 5 minutes to get to Royal Bay HS and local beaches.  A three minute drive to Olympic View Golf Course. Ten minutes to Royal Roads University, West Shore Parks and Rec (Q Center etc), West Shore Town Center, Cineplex, Liquor Stores or any amenities or stores you may need. Also a ten minute drive will get you to Westhills and Langford City Center, Glen Lake, and Langford Lake.
host_about: Welcome to our Garden Suite in beautiful Colwood! My name is Kim and I live with my husband, Jeff, and our three children, Jack, Ajay, and Jenna. We have enjoyed home sharing throughout our travels and are excited to share our home as hosts ourselves. We love the outdoors, geocaching, and exploring the endless opportunities to be in nature. You will often find us at the beach making driftwood forts or trail blazing in the forest. We are looking forward to meeting you and hope our home can be an enjoyable part of your next travel adventure.

name: Moose n’ Brix Cottage with Ocean View
description: The Moose n’ Brix Cottage is nestled on the hillside facing southwest so you will see the sunset every night. This cozy and rustic home features a huge wrap around deck where you can sit and enjoy the forested neighbourhood and ocean view. We are minutes away from the ocean, and centrally located so that you can easily reach the many activities and attractions Pender Island has to offer.
neighborhood_overview:
This cottage is only 15 minutes from the ferry terminal, 2 minutes from whale watching, and 5 minutes from the main shops and restaurants.

Looking to get active? Head on over to the unique 27-hole Golf Island Disc Park (12 minute walk), or experience some of the many Hiking Trails on Pender Island.

Looking to relax? Stay in and enjoy the view from the patio and the cozy wood burning fireplace.

Other attractions (hours of operation may vary per season):
-9-hole Golf Course
-Sea Star Winery
-Marina Rentals (Paddle Boarding/Kayaks)
-Farmer’s Market (Saturday’s only)
-Twin Island Cider Tasting
-Hiking Trails (Mount Norman & more)
-Whale watching (free, from many of the local beaches)

Wildlife that we often see from our beaches: Orcas, Humpbacks, Porpoises, Seals & Otters.

Wildlife that we often see in our yard, and all around the island: Black tailed deer, eagles, canaries, wood peckers, vultures,

name: Olympic View
description:
This Home is Exempt from BC Laws Prohibiting Short Stays. Come Stay with Us!

Welcome to Olympic View Cabin~

Enjoy stunning views over the Olympic Mountains and Strait of Juan de Fuca from the living room. Five minutes' walk across the road, visit beautiful Gordon's Beach. Gray whales pass by this home in the spring as they migrate to northern feeding grounds, returning again in the fall. Roaming pods of resident killer whales can also be seen offshore, as well as otters, seals, and sea lions.
neighborhood_overview: Located 10 minutes outside the town of Sooke, this home offers a wonderful escape into nature while being just an hour away from BC's capital city, Victoria. The ocean, parks, hiking, and myriad outdoor activities are all minutes away.

name: Wickham's Wake - Wild Luxury 3BR Oceanfront Rental
description: Enjoy wild luxury in this beautiful oceanfront rental with all the amenities of home, and access to some of best fishing and hiking on the west coast of Vancouver Island.  After a day of exploring Port Renfrew on land or sea, prepare your meals in a fully equipped kitchen or on the propane BBQ overlooking the water.  Enjoy meals family-style at the large wood dining table that seats six. There are three outdoor living areas for you to enjoy, including a fire pit under the stars.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in a the Wild Coast Cottage community. There are neighbours close by. Privacy may be limited in outdoor areas.

Please note that each cottage in the neighbourhood is privately owned. If you visit at another cottage and bring dishes, chairs etc. please be sure to return them to their original cottage. Some cottages are rented like ours, but most are used only by their owners and families. Please be respectful of their privacy and property.
host_about:
Ken and Joy embarked on the journey of purchasing Handsome Dan’s from Handsome Dan and The French Girl in the summer of 2020 amongst all the chaos of covid-19. 

They were looking for a business they could call their own and benefit from all their hard work and ideas instead of seeing CEO’s and upper office management always reaping the rewards, while telling other managers and workers they needed to cut back, or there were no bonuses for the year. 

The journey here was not easy - they spent 6 months apart while trying to sell their house in Saskatchewan, and then in late April 2021 they got some wonderful news - their current tenant insurer in BC said they would cover a landlord policy for a house in SK. 

In May 2021 Ken gave away or had to throw away 98% of the household items they had collected over the years - since they were moving from a huge house in SK just over 3000 sq ft with an extra wide 2 car garage into a less than 650 sq. Ft basement suite in BC. 

The transition of purchasing Handsome Dan’s and moving halfway across the country during a pandemic none the less wasn’t the easiest but they got through and now they are excited to expand and build Handsome Dan’s vacation rental property management in Port Renfrew and across the island to help cottage owners see a return on their investment, and for guests to have an amazing experience from the time they book their vacation till the time they leave; and even after raving about the experience they had at a Handsome Dan property. 

Port Renfrew is a favourite destination for a day or overnight trip on Vancouver Island. Each visit, no matter what time of year you are consumed by the natural majesty of this little community and the breath taking earthly beauty that surrounds it. 

We invite you to stay in our cottages and enjoy a few days, or weeks any time of the year. There is much to do and see. Or simply do nothing for extended periods of time, but sit quietly and listen to the ocean.  All of the cottages are privately owned and decorated to the taste of the owners.  We invite you to check them  out and are excited to share this special place with you.

name: Jordan River's (JR's) Nest
description: Ultra modern west coast inspired retreat nestled among the trees, under big skies and the nearby ocean. This suite boasts two bedrooms, and a comfortable Queen-size sofabed. Fully outfitted kitchen with all of the essentials to create your savory and sweet. Laundry in-suite. Full bathroom in-suite with heated floors. Outdoor shower and sauna also await you. Unwind sitting by the picnic and campfire spot. Enjoy a local cafe and many beautiful beaches along this side of the coast!
neighborhood_overview:
The Pacific Marine Trail boasts something for everyone - whether you are an explorer, hiker, adventurer, biker, surf/paddle boarder, boater - there are endless places to enjoy on this side of the Island with what you love to do in your free time. Take your pick of a beach - French, Sandcut, Jordan River, China, Mystic, Sombrio or Botanical - to name a few. Fall in love with the beaches and re-connect with yourself and loved ones.

Local cafe, The Cold Shoulder, is just down the hill from us offering fresh baked goods, hot and cold drinks. The coveted Shirley Delicious is a 10 minute drive down the road featuring unique breakfast/lunch delights and special treats to take on outdoor adventures. Wood-fired pizza at Stoked (seasonal operation) makes for a delicious lunch or supper in.
host_about:
Hello and nice to meet you!!!

We are a Jordan River family that has enjoyed our property and area for the past seven years as a vacation spot and in 2017 we decided to make it our family home! Tannis and Jim have their own tales of where they have travelled in younger years,  but still feel like they are on a vacation everyday in their piece of paradise here.

Jim is an avid woodworker and would love to share his expertise with you when you visit! Tannis is a homemaker and loves all things children, cooking, baking and making each day an adventure!  

We enjoy creature comforts at home and hope you enjoy them with your stay with us!!!

neighborhood_overview:
Victoria is a sophisticated gem of timeless quality, named for one of history’s most remarkable women. With a temperate climate and British Colonial heritage, Victoria is a perfect destination year-round. Sights include the world-famous Butchart Gardens, Royal British Columbia Museum and the amazing Victoria Butterfly Gardens. Stroll through Goldstream park where salmon spawn, eagles fly and waterfalls cascade down cliffs. After a full day, head back to the resort to linger over tea. The rooms are angled to maximize water views, and the fireplace will keep you cozy as you look out over the moonlit bay.

Popular Attractions
The Butchart Gardens
Located on an expansive country estate, the 55-acre gardens feature floral displays, meandering paths and expansive lawns. 15 mi.

Royal BC Museum and IMAX Theatre
Learn about the human and natural history of British Columbia through exciting exhibits at the Royal BC Museum. The museum also features the 400-seat

Stroll through Goldstream park where salmon spawn, eagles fly and waterfalls cascade down cliffs. After a full day, head back to the resort to linger over tea. The rooms are angled to maximize water views, and the fireplace will keep you cozy as you look out over the moonlit bay.

Popular Attractions
The Butchart Gardens
Located on an expansive country estate, the 55-acre gardens feature floral displays, meandering paths and expansive lawns. 15 mi.

Royal BC Museum and IMAX Theatre
Learn about the human and natural history of British Columbia through exciting exhibits at the Royal BC Museum. The museum also features the 400-seat

neighborhood_overview: Cedar Hill is a centrally-located neighborhood, situated right where Saanich East meets Victoria. The beautifully-maintained property of the Cedar Hill Golf Club, which takes up much of the neighbourhood's area, is one of the local draws to this part of town, while the community's quiet environment is another.

name: Breathtaking views! Escape to Sooke Mountain House
description: Welcome to Sooke Mountain House, a hidden gem along the Pacific Marine Circle Route, where lush rainforests and deep coves await your exploration. Perched on the slopes of Mount Brule, our. 3000 square foot home offers unparalleled views of the Sooke Basin, the Juan de Fuca Strait, the Olympic Mountains of Washington State, and the surrounding area ensuring a truly mesmerizing stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Best Locations

Sooke area
- Whiffen Spit (incredible anytime of day, easy 3km walk on maintained surface, dog-friendly)
- Sooke Pot Holes (5 minutes up Sooke River Road)
- East Sooke Park (tons of trails from gentle to difficult)
-Ella Beach (shhhh this beach is a secret! Turn left after John Muir School on West Coast Road)

Best Beaches
Whiffen Spit
Ella Beach
French Beach
China Beach
Sombrio Beach
Botanical Beach


Best Coffee Houses
- Stick in the Mud (hip vibe - they grind their own)
- Serious Coffee (good small chain quality)
- Little Vienna Bakery (for great coffee, food and a slower pace)
- Jenny's Tea Shoppe (in-house pastries, coffees and meatpies)

Best Restaurants
- Route 14 (chef created pub food and celebrated liquid fare - truly amazing but be prepared to wait in line any day of the week!)
- Hara Sushi (best in town and probably one of best in Vict
host_about:
We love sharing our incredible home with visitors, friends and family. We live here and it still feels like we are renting a piece of paradise! We love enjoying the view, the tranquility and the peace with nature. 

In our neighborhood, we enjoy taking our two little girls and our dog Blue to Whiffen Spit, Ella Beach and all the places in between and farther afield. We enjoy meeting people and soaking up the relaxed Sooke community atmosphere.

We are lucky to spent a lot of time in beautiful Sooke because Eoghan works from home and Maitreyi travels as a flight attendant. 

We love traveling, hiking and living. Our favourite way to travel is to setup a base where we can meet the locals and explore the area. We love AirBNB for this! We have stayed at some incredible places, met some amazing people and formed great memories! 

A Bit About Us
Eoghan got his start as a photographer and filmmaker carrying too much camera equipment on wilderness trips to some of the remote places in the world. Over the past decade, many adventures have followed in some of the amazing places on this earth including a solar powered filming trek across the Zanskar region of India, a double helicopter evacuation in 96 hours from Baffin Island and documenting multiple marathon cycling journeys across Canada and the United States.

Eoghan believes that photographs and imagery of large places and scenes should be reproduced as large as possible. His panoramic fine art prints have exhibited at galleries in the Vancouver area as well as at juried events in Toronto, Calgary and Vancouver. His art prints adorn personal and commercial spaces as far away as Japan and Ireland and can be found throughout Sooke Mountain House.

Maitreyi is a born traveler. Since as long as she can remember she has always kept one bag packed and one eye open for the next memory. She works for one of Canada's airlines and has been fortunate enough to explore many parts of the world.

name: Gulf Island Private Cabin Getaway
description: Beautiful cottage and location is a must to see. Enjoy an oceanfront cabin to yourself, with two bedrooms and upstairs, pull out queen sofa bed downstairs. Enjoy your huge deck directly overlooking the water, and all the amenities. This place will allow you to relax and romance, or to have an outdoorsy family getaway on this amazing gulf island.  There is a fantastic shop and restaurant down the stairs from us, game room, and a swimming pool to enjoy in the high season.
neighborhood_overview: Pender Island is a laid back gulf island, with lots to explore. The cabin itself is set on a Marina. The island, has a  lot to do. There are 5-10 amazing restaurants and pubs, many beaches, great hikes to whale spotting locations, a golf course, kayak rentals, hikes through enchanted forests, local art tours, and winery and cider producers that offer tastings. There are kids activities organized through ptargimagan arts, and a small farmers market on Saturdays at the community centre.  New movies are also played upstairs in the community centre on most weekends. Concerts and performances are often occurring at venues around the island. Crabbing is also a prevalent pastime for these islanders.
host_about: I am a wildlife biologist, consulting business owner, and outdoor enthusiast. I love to host people and to be hosted at amazing places around the world.

name: 2 BDRM HOME newly renovated! Bright & Spacious
description:
A newly renovated kitchen & bathroom in beautiful character home. Peaceful and spacious in the heart of Oak Bay in a friendly neighbourhood located only 5 minutes from Willows beach and 10 minutes from downtown Victoria. This home boasts 2 large bedrooms, a large common room area, a large and fully equipped kitchen and a large front patio overlooking the back yard. Perfect for groups of 4 and family gatherings.
Situated in a perfect and central neighbourhood with tons of amenities close by.
neighborhood_overview: Oak Bay is a very popular and posh neighbourhood! The best of the best! Located only minutes from beautiful Willows beach and boasts of popular coffee shops like Vanilla Cafe and famous eating spots like The Galley's delicious fish & chips in nearby Estevan village.
host_about: My husband and I are fully retired and spend half of our time in our city home in Victoria and the other half at our property up island.

name: The Hideaway Cabin in Jordan River
description: Enjoy this open modern concept cabin with full loft, large soaker tub to relax and unwind. You’ll have 2.5 acre land all to yourself. The full kitchen has everything you need to cook meals while listening to the crackle of the wood burning stove. We have a nice large fire pit to roast marshmallows for the kiddies. Just minute away from surfing, hiking, beach combing and beautiful star gazing.
neighborhood_overview:
So much to do in JR. surfing just minutes away, lots of hiking to China beach, sombrio and Port Renfrew.
We love the evenings hanging out at the out door fire pit.

name: The Nest - Family Accommodation
description:
The Nest is a family-friendly oasis near the Sooke town core that is your home away from home. It's particularly well suited to families with children or small groups that want their own space (inside and out) as a jumping-off spot for enjoying southern Vancouver Island. With beautiful forest trails and the famous outer beaches just minutes away, Sooke is a thriving community with delicious coffee, several local breweries, regular farmers markets and loads of local charm.

+1-250-266-7788
neighborhood_overview: Quiet residential neighborhood is an easy 10-minute walk to the town core and a great restaurant, coffee shop, and brewery.

name: Into The Woods B&B
description: Rustic, artsy, comfortable: set on a beautiful wooded acreage near a stream, this private two-bedroom cabin and studio is located mid-island, just a 10-minute walk to the lake or 5-minute drive to the beach. Simple breakfast items contained in fridge. Two queen beds, sofa-bed, microwave, bathroom with shower, separate toilet room and large deck/patio with BBQ, overlooking the forest. Top-quality linens; tea, coffee, etc; wifi; lots of parking; keypad entry.
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located a short walk from the lake and a short drive from the beach, it is only a 7 minute drive to Ganges and 8 minutes from Fulford.
host_about: Bruce and Susan love art, hiking in nature, good food and libations, travelling, and hockey.

name: Trailhead Guesthaus w/ Sauna at Jordan River
description:
Need to get away from it all? Come relax and unwind at our modern newly-built Westcoast cabin. Nestled in the rain forest and situated next to a tranquil creek, this 1500 sq ft luxury getaway sleeps 6 and is perfect for families.

Our accommodation allows you to experience nature at its finest on our private acreage. Go for a surf in the morning, lay in the hammock for an afternoon siesta, then enjoy the stars at night as you stroll down the path to our cedar sauna.
neighborhood_overview: If you care to venture 2 minutes down the road, you can surround yourself in the lush rainforest and enormous trees on the trails to China Beach. Watch the ocean waves crash as you stroll on the beach at Jordan River.  There is a coffee shop 2 minutes away and a restaurant at Point No Point, a 10-minute drive from the cabin. Other shopping and amenities can be found in Sooke or Port Renfrew.
host_about: We are a teacher and a carpenter who love to be in the woods, spend time in the ocean, and drink good coffee. We are parents to a little person, who reminds us that there is magic in everything.

name: Executive Bear Mountain Home
description:
Beautiful executive 4 bedroom home on Bear Mountain. This home is located near the top of Bear Mountain in a quiet, family friendly neighbourhood. The home is equipped with everything you will need for a relaxing holiday. Located next to a world class golf course and only 20 minutes from downtown Victoria.
There is a separate one bedroom apartment that does not have access to the main house. We look forward to welcoming you to your home away from away home!
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood. Located in a cul du sac.
host_about:
Derek and Caren Porter. 

We have three very busy teenagers and my husband Derek is an Airline Pilot.
We live just 25min north of Bear Mountain.  I Caren, will be dealing with all the bookings and questions for the most part. We are excited to share our home with you. 

Please contact us for any questions. 
Thank you!

name: Furnished home - 1 Block from ocean
description:
Our comfortable house is a block from the beach! It is located on a quiet tree lined street in Oak Bay, Victoria. Walk to fantastic cafes, eateries, pubs, wine bars, art galleries, shopping, grocery stores and other amenities.

The house comes fully furnished with all amenities, internet and utilities included. Free off street parking.

This beautiful neighbourhood features amazing views of the ocean framed by the towering Olympic mountains and beautiful urban parks in an old neighbourhood.
neighborhood_overview:
We have easy access by bike, bus or car to downtown Victoria. See and do all that the city and surrounding area has to offer while leaving the noise behind to sleep in one of the most beautiful neighbourhoods in the region.

Oak Bay is advertised around the world as a premier place to buy a home for a great reason. The neighbourhood provides exceptional living opportunities in a well established neighbourhood that is filled with old homes, parks, amenities, and endless access to the ocean.

Wake up in the morning and walk down to the beach with your coffee! Perhaps some whales are passing by as you walk the coastal trails and enjoy the day by the sea.

We're a block away from the beach, along a beautiful tree lined street. At the beach, you will have wild views of the Pacific ocean and the towering snow capped Olympic Mountains. Great seaside walking opportunities make this place special.

Around the corner is a cafe (you have a choice o
host_about:
We're a family that has traveled and lived around the world.  We know what it's like to arrive at the place where you are planning to spend the night, and it's our plan to make it as relaxed and easy going for you as it can get.

We're into the outdoors and so we spend a lot of our time hiking, canoeing, kayaking, camping and getting around by bike or foot.  We like adventure and we really enjoy other cultures and traditions.

No matter where you come from, you'll feel at home here.  Being laid back, you can tell us all about yourself or come and go without a word.  Whatever suits your trip, we're just here to offer you a friendly place to drop your bags no matter who you are.

name: Family Cottage @ Horner Park
description: This charming, 1950’s single level, bungalow  is fully furnished with old world charm in a pretty garden setting. A perfect cottage for a family or group that sleeps up to 8 people. Pets welcome with a fully fenced front yard and courtyard area. Neighbourhood park directly across the street. Great location with free onsite parking for two cars, near bus, shops, UVIC/Camosun, short drive to downtown.
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in a wonderful, safe neighbourhood across the street from a large park with a children's playground, multisport court, softball,  Fitcore Extreme obstacle course, and tons of green space with benches and picnic tables. Hike up Mount Tolmie at the end of the street or walk through Finnerty Gardens at UVIC, both are only a 5 minute walk away from the house. All shops and services are within walking distance or a 2 minute drive away to Shelbourne Plaza. Monthly rentals welcome, Sept to April for working professionals or people relocating to/from Victoria.

name: Character Stay across Swan Lake Nature Sanctuary
description: The best of what Victoria's character home charm and modern west coast living style has to offer. Centrally located between downtown, ferries, and YYJ airport yet tucked away in the blissfully quiet neighbourhood of Swan Lake with stunning views! With a nature reserve across the street, there is no shortage of beautiful wildlife including humming birds, deer, and bunnies; leaving one feeling at home in a true nature sanctuary.
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to this truly idyllic getaway in beautiful Victoria! Nestled in the blissfully quiet neighborhood of Swan Lake with stunning views, you are surrounded by a nature reserve, with lots of wildlife including hummingbirds, deer, and bunnies! The location couldn't be more ideal - just 10-12 minutes to Thetis Lake, 15 minutes to the airport or to downtown Victoria, 20 minutes to the ferry, and only minutes by car or bike to both Elk and Beaver Lake. Enjoy the best of both worlds - explore the city, and when you're ready for a quieter atmosphere, you can completely escape the hustle & bustle of downtown. Come experience pristine nature and tranquility on your next Victoria getaway!
host_about: Longtime resident of #YYJ, Real Estate Professional with Re/Max Camosun for 30 years. Be it vacation rentals, long term rentals or finding your forever home; thoughtful homes is what I do best. As a DIY/HGTV enthusiast, attention to detail and well thought out living spaces are important to me. I am an avid outdoorsman, enjoy home cooking but also cycling, running, triathlons including the Iron Man (5x), coming 34th I(AG) at World Championship in Kona. Working and chatting with all types of people is in my nature, please feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns.

name: Trailbreak
description:
New in 2024. Shared Sauna!

Welcome to our West Coast home! This Ocean side property is owned by 4 families who love the outdoors and we are excited to share it with you! The space has been created to encourage a sense of community with all who stay here. We hope you enjoy the short 4 minute walk to the beach, (please note running shoes are recommended. The trail is steep and has obstacles such as roots and rocks) the endless trails nearby or the amazing yard and space the property has to offer.
neighborhood_overview:
Old growth trees, waterfalls, mushrooms, breaking waves.

This property borders Juan de Fuca Provincial Park (China Beach Provincial Park) and has a private trail to a beautiful cobblestone beach. You can walk the beach to Cold Shoulder café for an Americano and baked good at low tide, or use it as base camp to start your hike on the Juan de Fuca trail (talk to us about parking your vehicle and shuttle).

Explore the nearby parks, beaches, surf breaks, old growth, and trails: China Beach, Mystic Beach, Jordan River, Sandcut.

Only a short drive to other attractions like Sombrio Beach, Botany Bay, Avatar Grove, West Coast Trail.

name: The Empress Suite with Stunning Ocean & City Views
description:
Business#: 00040896

Spectacular ocean views await you from this 12th floor modern condo. This spacious 2 bed 2 bath home features floor to ceiling windows, king sized beds, luxurious walk in showers, en suite, walk in closet, designer kitchen and more. Watch the sun set on the water from the 400 square foot sun deck overlooking the Empress and inner harbour. Located in the heart of Downtown Victoria, steps from the Empress, Parliament Buildings, Museum, shopping and more.
neighborhood_overview: Downtown Victoria, kitty-corner to the world-famous Empress Hotel and within steps from the beautiful Inner-Harbour offers a spectacular location surrounded by lush gardens and cascading waterfalls featuring fitness centre, pool and hot tub. Enjoy all that downtown Victoria has to offer from restaurants to entertainment, theatre, cosmopolitan boutique stores, fine dining, bustling coffee shops, spas, tourist attractions and markets.
host_about:
We love to travel ourselves and know how important staying at the right place is for a memorable experience. We grew up in Victoria and take pride in the fact that we live in one of the most beautiful cities in the world. 

- Ira & Agata

name: Lovely Oak Bay Family Home
description: Situated in one of the best neighbourhoods in Victoria, Oak Bay is a beautiful area and close to everything. Our house is very well equipped for families or people of all ages.  There are 4 bedrooms with 2 queen beds and 2 double size beds and 2 full bathrooms. There is lots of outdoor space to enjoy your summer, and relax when you’re not out enjoying this amazing city!  We have a natural gas barbecue on the sunny back deck and a large trampoline as well as many outdoor toys and games.
neighborhood_overview: We are a 10 minute walk from a wonderful sandy beach, great fun during the day or wonderful for an evening picnic. name: 3 Bedroom B&B with Balcony & Beautiful Views
description:
We welcome you to stay at our home for a relaxing retreat on Salt Spring Island! Enjoy breathtaking views, access to a vast network of trails, and our famous sunsets. You will have private use of our upstairs which contains a bathroom (basic toiletries provided), 2 bedrooms with queen beds, and a private balcony with unobstructed views of the property.

We serve a continental breakfast from 7:00 - 9:00 am in the kitchen or on the patio and we will do our best to accommodate special requests.
neighborhood_overview:
We are located only 3 minutes away (by vehicle) from the Vesuvius Ferry Terminal to Vancouver Island.
And we are approx. 10 minutes away (by vehicle) to Ganges (the town center).
host_about:
Hello! We are Romy and Bryce and live on Salt Spring Island. We are originally from Alberta and moved to the island 10 years ago – we were drawn to the natural beauty, relaxed pace, and friendly people. 

We will be happy to share our recommendations to ensure you get the most out of your trip but if you are just looking for a relaxing getaway, we trust you’ll find that on our property with our breathtaking views, network of trails behind our house, and famous sunsets! 

We love to travel, especially on cycling trips, and enjoy experiencing different cultures and meeting new people. We are excited to have the opportunity to welcome you to our home in this special part of the world and hope to meet you soon. 

If you are interested in event space (weddings, retreats, etc.) we have a barn on our property to accommodate all types of gatherings.  Please visit our website for more information; Stone Bridge Island Farm Salt Spring Island.

name: Majestic View B&B
description:
Rent one or up to four rooms (with ensuite bathroom for each) in Majestic View B&B. Spacious, spectacular 270º view of Pacific Ocean and Gulf Islands, back-dropped by Washington’s Mount Baker and BC’s Coastal Mountains. Wraparound deck on main level and balcony access from each bedroom.

Relax, feel at home, enjoy the dramatic views, or walk into a cathedral of towering trees in the adjacent park. Each room can hold two guests: double bed, queen, twin x 2 and king.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is on 40 acres in a private, rural part of Salt Spring Island, but only 15 minutes drive to the town of Ganges. It has spectacular 180º views of the southern Gulf Islands, the Burgoyne Valley, Fulford Harbor, the Coast Mountains, Mt. Baker, and the Olympic Range. Only two or three other properties on Salt Spring Island enjoy such a panoramic view.

Salt Spring is known for its waterfront and ocean-view homes, artistic community, organic farms, and hillside vineyards. Since the island has over 10,000 residents (up to 20,000 in the summer), Ganges Village is self-sufficient, with normal town services, including restaurants, supermarkets, gas-stations, a 65-bed hospital, and various other shops and amenities.

The island enjoys a mild, temperate climate. It’s mountainous, with protected parks that offer some of the most outstanding scenery in the world.

Nature is enjoyed everywhere: sailing, kayaking, whale-watching, golfing, swimming in the islan
host_about: I am a professional writer who has travelled to over 100 countries on all six continents. For  the last 14 years I've lived on Salt Spring Island, and look forward to welcoming you to this wonderful newly-renovated home. You will enjoy what many people consider the best views on on Salt Spring Island.

name: A Suite on Colquitz River
description: Spacious, simply furnished, ground level suite on the Colquitz River near Cuthbert Holmes Park, a nature sanctuary. A place to relax after your busy day.  Large backyard with private parking. Close to shopping, a large movie theatre, and easy transportation access.  A 15 minute walk to the beautiful Gorge Waterway which most tourists miss!  Convenient access to the ferries (U.S. and Canadian), downtown, Langford, Colwood, Sooke and up island.
neighborhood_overview: Close to Cuthbert Holmes Park  - a beautiful nature sanctuary - geese, ducks, heron, eagles and squirrels.... and my home is on the Colquitz River.  The river is tidal and flows to the Pacific Ocean (in front of the Empress Hotel downtown), so the tide will go in and out in front of my house.   Walk to the beautiful Gorge Waterway - 15 minutes!  Grocery stores, pharmacy and liquor stores within 5 min drive.

name: Bright and spacious flat in a castle
description:
Gorgeous stylish large apartment nestled into the trees of Rockland. Feel peace and privacy; out of every window is sky and trees, with ocean glimpses and views of the roofs of Craigdarroch castle. You will be steps away from both Craigdarrough Castle and Government House.

The apartment is in a heritage building nearly as old as Craigdarroch, built in 1910 for the architect who designed Government house.

It’s quiet and peaceful, yet an easy walk to downtown and very central.
neighborhood_overview: We are located in beautiful Rockland, a community of heritage mansions and wonderful gardens. Close to attractions (Craigdarrough, Government House, Moss street Market), and an easy 15 min walk or 5 min drive to downtown.
host_about:
I love the outdoors, pottery, and finding new places to enjoy good food. 

I use Airbnb both as a host and guest; I appreciate the way it can enhance an experience of a new place and create community. I look forward to meeting you.

name: Hilltop Retreat, Spacious Suite/Private HotTub/Gym
description:
A single home at the top of a private road with gorgeous views of the neighborhood. A quiet spot and short ride to Bear Mountain Resort, Spa and Golf course and within easy walking distance to The Loghouse Pub and shopping. Near lakes and hiking trails.

Suite has 2 bedrooms, a NHL hockey media room leading out to patio area and hot tub. Kitchenette for food prep with a large number of appliances and a small gym provided.

Extras on request: extra large cot, Margarita maker/ice, pizza dome
neighborhood_overview:
Parks/Walking trails
Gowland Todd (10 min) – Hiking trail that just keeps going and has some scenic views of the Saanich inlet.
Lone Tree Hill (10 min) – Good hike up to the top that is not too strenuous with some incredible views.
Mount Finlayson (10 min) – the standard for local hikers. Most other hills are compared to this one. You can go up the hill ~45-60 min or head the other way under the highway to visit the waterfall. Good place for picnics where they have a firepits and picnic tables. And check out the salmon run mid-October to December.
Lakes
Thetis Lake (5 min), Florence Lake (5 min), Langford Lake (10 min), Lake Cowichan (60 min), Sooke Potholes (50 min) – are fun spots to hike and cool off
Downtown Victoria (15-25 min depending on traffic). Lots of unique shops, restaurants, inner harbor and legislative buildings
Shopping malls – Westshore Mall, Mayfair Shopping Centre, Downtown Victoria has lots to visit

Other Highlights
host_about:
Hi, I am a Naval Technical Officer with the Royal Canadian Navy and enjoy travelling myself.  In order to keep a healthy travel budget, AirBnB has offered both hosting and stays that make travel a little bit more affordable.

I love wine and food tours both local and around the world. I also participate in the local country music festivals at Lake Cowichan and enjoy hanging out with my pet pig Penny.

name: Pender Otter Bay walk/drive to this perfect spot
description:
Comfortable and fully equipped, this cozy cabin will be your home base for your visit to beautiful Pender.
Water sports rental, games room, coffee shop, 2 pools onsite.
Overlooking the marina, this cabin is equipped with a full kitchen including dishwasher, dishes, pots pans etc are available for your use.
Cook or BBQ at the cabin, eat at the onsite bistro, local restaurant or have dinner delivered.
TV, DVD player and wifi available for your use throughout your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Pender Island enjoys a sub-Mediterranean (this climate is known as "The Hawaii of Canada") climate and features open farmland, rolling forested hills, several lakes and small mountains, as well as many coves and beaches. Pender Island offers the most public beach access points of any of the Gulf Islands.

Pender Island is a popular destination for cycling, fishing, hiking, boating, sailing, scuba diving and other outdoor pursuits. The island also boasts a 9-hole golf course as well as a 27-hole disc golf course(frisbee golf). Pender Island also has numerous art galleries, shops, and restaurants and hosts a variety of local events throughout the year, including the Pender Island Fall Fair and the Lantern Festival. On Saturday mornings during the summer, the Pender Island Farmer’s Market at the Community Hall offers local produce and handcrafts, as well as entertainment.
host_about: West Coast Canadian with a passion for family, business, hiking and travel.

name: Shore 2 Please - 3 bdrm, 2 kitchen with ocean view
description: This newly built cottage (2018) in Port Renfrew has 3 bedrooms, 2 fully equipped kitchens and 2 full size bathrooms.  It has spectacular ocean and mountain views with 2 fire tables and a gas barbeque on the balcony.
neighborhood_overview:
The area is popular for fishing, cycling and hiking. Surfing, paddle boarding and kayaking are also very popular in this area. Sites within minutes of the cottage includes Botanical Beach, Lizard Lake, Fairy Lake, Avatar Grove, World Famous West Coast and Juan de Fuca Trails. A new, full service marina is just a 5 minute walk away.

Other amenities include Port Renfrew Pub, Gateway Marina Bistro, Tomi's Cafe, Coastal Kitchen Cafe, a general store open 11-7 (including beer and wine sales) and a gift shop on the pier.
host_about: Hi! We are excited to have a place in Port Renfrew.  I was born and raised on Vancouver Island and love it here. We love to travel and explore new places; Europe, Mexico and Costa Rica are our favourites. We know you will want to come back again and again to this gem at the edge of the famous West Coast Trail.
