name: #231A - Shore 2 Please - Upper Unit (Oceanviews)
description: Experience the ultimate West Coast feel in this 2 bedroom upper suite cottage with stellar ocean views off the huge balcony with propane fire pit and gas BBQ overlooking the beach, mountains and Gordon River where the West Coast Trail begins.  This UPPER LEVEL called Shore 2 Please sleeps up to 6 with 2 bedrooms (1 king and 1 queen) and sofa bed. The living room has a gas fireplace and the kitchen a gas stove.
neighborhood_overview:
If you don’t feel like cooking The Renfrew Pub, Bridgeman’s West Coast Eatery, Coastal Kitchen Café and Tomi’s Home Cooking are all a short walk away. The local General Store is about a 1km walk along Parkinson Rd and has a small selection of groceries, beer, wine and a cash machine. It’s a good idea to stock up on groceries on your way to Port Renfrew either in Sooke on your way from Victoria or in Lake Cowichan.

The list of activities in Port Renfrew are endless; seeing some of Canada’s tallest trees, getting close and personal with marine life at Botanical Beach and hiking the West Coast and Juan De Fuca trails. There is also surfing, beach combing, kayaking, beach walking, whale watching tours, winter storm watching and world class fishing.
host_about: Hi! We are excited to have a place in Port Renfrew.  I was born and raised on Vancouver Island and love it here. We love to travel and explore new places; Europe, Mexico and Costa Rica are our favourites. We know you will want to come back again and again to this gem at the edge of the famous West Coast Trail.

name: Galiano Island Cabin
description: This is a cosy cabin sits on seven acres of land with water access.  It has a firewood stove and hardwood floors in the main part of the cabin - tiling the living room.  The decor is country chic.   The property is rural about 11 miles from any store but close to beautiful hiking trails, and has access to a staircase down to a deck at the water where we swim.  We face Saltspring Island and the southern tip of Wallace - in fact it is just a kayak ride across Trincomali channel to Salt Spring.
neighborhood_overview: Forested and secluded 7 acre lot with waterfront access.  There is a sheep farm neighbouring across from the cabin and we ask that you ensure if you have a dog they do not run or bark at the sheep.  Please also ensure if you have a dog they do not chase the deer or other wildlife on the property.
host_about: I love Galiano Island more than anywhere in the world, but I work internationally so it never feels like I am there enough.  I am a vegetarian meditator.  My husband Tim is a classical music composer.  We have a rescue Flatboat Retriever named Leisha.

name: Pender Island cottage for 6, pool, no car needed!
description: Our tranquil cottage has beautiful views of the water, sleeps 6, and is only a 10 minute walk from the ferry to Vancouver & Victoria. Wake up to cormorants and otters. Use one of the two bikes in the cottage to explore the Pender Islands or bring your own. Includes free wifi, a full kitchen, gas fireplace, smart tv, and one parking space.

host_about: Denis and Anthonia live in Vancouver, and bought 1/4 of a cottage in 2019. We have a teenager and we're originally from Ottawa and Toronto respectively. Denis designs bus routes and Anthonia runs a non-profit in STEM education. We love our little Pender escape and love living vicariously through our guests :)

name: Cougars Hollow Guest Suite/ bottom half house
description: You will find Couger Hollow Guest suite nestled in a private wooded area in close proximity to John Dean Provincial Park, Victoria International Airport, Sidney, and Saanichton. The cozy two bedroom accommodations include a fully provisioned kitchen and all the comforts from home.
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a cul d sac with 5 houses including us in residence. It is a quiet neighborhood and would expect our guests to respect that.

We live at the bottom of John Dean Rd. This road will take you 2km up to John Dean Provincial Park where you can explore several trails of different levels of mobility.

name: Marina View Cottage at Currents in Otter Bay
description:
An upscale 2 Bedroom Cottage overlooking the Currents Resort grounds and the Otter Bay Marina.

The spacious grounds and shoreline are available for all Currents guests to enjoy.

The Bistro Cafe and the swimming pool are open seasonally from the May long weekend to the October Thanksgiving weekend- weather permitting.

The resort is managed and maintained to a high standard by Currents Guest Services staff who are onsite Monday - Saturday.
neighborhood_overview: Currents is a well managed resort adjacent to the Otter Bay Marina. Pender Island offers a variety of activities such as hiking, kayaking, golf, disc golf,  beaches and more.

name: Explorer's Retreat | Sauna & Bunkhouse & Fire pit
description:
Along with a bunkhouse, our cottage can sleep 6 guests, with 4 in the main cottage & 2 in the bunkhouse. The main cottage has a queen-size bed & a pull-out sofa in the family room, while the bunkhouse has one double bed.

The open living & kitchen area has everything guests need for a comfortable stay. Fully-equipped kitchen, full bathroom, TV, Apple TV, Netflix & WI-FI provided. In the living area, a cozy gas fire place and beautiful nature photographs captured by local photographer TJ Watt.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in a the Wild Coast Cottage community. There are neighbours close by. Privacy may be limited in outdoor areas.

Please note that each cottage in the neighbourhood is privately owned. If you visit at another cottage and bring dishes, chairs etc. please be sure to return them to their original cottage. Some cottages are rented like ours, but most are used only by their owners and families. Please be respectful of their privacy and property.

If you don’t feel like cooking The Renfrew Pub, Bridgeman’s West Coast Eatery, Coastal Kitchen Café and Tomi’s Home Cooking are all a short walk away. The local General Store is about a 1km walk along Parkinson Rd and has a small selection of groceries, beer, wine and a cash machine. It’s a good idea to stock up on groceries on your way to Port Renfrew either in Sooke on your way from Victoria or in Lake Cowichan.
The list of activities in Port Renfrew are endless; seeing some of Canada’s tallest trees, getting clo
host_about:
Ken and Joy embarked on the journey of purchasing Handsome Dan’s from Handsome Dan and The French Girl in the summer of 2020 amongst all the chaos of covid-19. 

They were looking for a business they could call their own and benefit from all their hard work and ideas instead of seeing CEO’s and upper office management always reaping the rewards, while telling other managers and workers they needed to cut back, or there were no bonuses for the year. 

The journey here was not easy - they spent 6 months apart while trying to sell their house in Saskatchewan, and then in late April 2021 they got some wonderful news - their current tenant insurer in BC said they would cover a landlord policy for a house in SK. 

In May 2021 Ken gave away or had to throw away 98% of the household items they had collected over the years - since they were moving from a huge house in SK just over 3000 sq ft with an extra wide 2 car garage into a less than 650 sq. Ft basement suite in BC. 

The transition of purchasing Handsome Dan’s and moving halfway across the country during a pandemic none the less wasn’t the easiest but they got through and now they are excited to expand and build Handsome Dan’s vacation rental property management in Port Renfrew and across the island to help cottage owners see a return on their investment, and for guests to have an amazing experience from the time they book their vacation till the time they leave; and even after raving about the experience they had at a Handsome Dan property. 

Port Renfrew is a favourite destination for a day or overnight trip on Vancouver Island. Each visit, no matter what time of year you are consumed by the natural majesty of this little community and the breath taking earthly beauty that surrounds it. 

We invite you to stay in our cottages and enjoy a few days, or weeks any time of the year. There is much to do and see. Or simply do nothing for extended periods of time, but sit quietly and listen to the ocean.  All of the cottages are privately owned and decorated to the taste of the owners.  We invite you to check them  out and are excited to share this special place with you.

name: The Boat Yard
description: This custom mid century style home is nestled amongst 2 acres of rainforest and beautifully landscaped food gardens. Our unique west coast hideaway features wrap around decks for sun all day, wood stove, radiant floor heating, and a covered bar for hosting. A short walk down our private trail will have you at the ocean for breathtaking sunsets. Minutes to provincial parks and numerous beaches, and a coffee shop right down the hill.
neighborhood_overview: Jordan River is 30 min from Sooke and Port Renfrew. A former logging town it is mostly known now for its rivermouth surf breaks and coffee shop. There are no stores or towns after sooke for groceries or libations until port renfrew and it’s limited at best. BYOB is a must. There is a great coffee shop on the bottom of the hill and a seasonal pizza spot in French beach.

name: Sandy Feet Retreat- Oceanfront 2BR, modern cottage
description:
Enjoy the Magnificent views from our modern oceanfront vacation home, just steps away from the ocean!

This is a brand new, fully furnished, 2 bedroom modern vacation home in Port Renfrew (The southwest coast of Vancouver Island)

This is the perfect cottage for a staycation, family getaway, family reunion or just with friends!!
neighborhood_overview:
Port Renfrew is located just 1.5 hours from Victoria and 2 hours from Nanaimo and is popular for fishing, cycling and hiking. Surfing, paddle boarding and kayaking down the Gordon River is also very popular. There are also many places to hike and explore including the gorgeous Botanical Beach and the old growth of Avatar Grove. Whether it’s ancient tall trees, gorgeous beaches, five-star fishing, surfing, or world famous hiking along the West Coast Trail everything is steps away from your front door.
Some amenities include: a gas station, restaurant, pub, café, and general store. If you do plan on cooking some elaborate meals, it might be best to plan ahead and bring food items with you.
Another thing to note is that there is no cell phone reception. Please plan your communications accordingly and remember that we offer free Wifi within the cottage.
It is important to note that there are power outages that occur in Port Renfrew, so please be prepared. Port Renfrew is ru
host_about: I am a proud husband and father of 2 young children. Both a traveller and a host. I love fishing and the outdoors, and exploring new destinations.

name: Entire Home near Uptown (Kid Friendly)
description:
3 bedroom family home close to Uptown, ocean, public transport, parks/playgrounds, rec centre, downtown, hiking, and supermarkets. It's about a 7 minute drive to downtown. You’ll love our home because of the cosiness, the brightness, the kid friendliness. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids). We have a family cat, so take note if you have cat allergies.

name: Victoria, BC Canada, 2 Bedroom Twin L #1
description:
Listing is entered as USD currency. Please check with AirBnB to ask if they are converting the currency to CAD.

I can accept a 1-night stay for a weekend night (Friday or Saturday) if the date is within 2 days of stay date.

Two Bedroom: Queen in master, twins in second bedroom, queen murphy bed in living area. Maximum occupancy 6.
neighborhood_overview:
Victoria is a sophisticated gem of timeless quality, named for one of history’s most remarkable women. With a temperate climate and British Colonial heritage, Victoria is a perfect destination year-round. Sights include the world-famous Butchart Gardens, Royal British Columbia Museum and the amazing Victoria Butterfly Gardens. Stroll through Goldstream park where salmon spawn, eagles fly and waterfalls cascade down cliffs. After a full day, head back to the resort to linger over tea. The rooms are angled to maximize water views, and the fireplace will keep you cozy as you look out over the moonlit bay.

Popular Attractions
The Butchart Gardens
Located on an expansive country estate, the 55-acre gardens feature floral displays, meandering paths and expansive lawns. 15 mi.

Royal BC Museum and IMAX Theatre

name: Charlie's Cozy Cabin near the Salish Sea
description: Charlies Cabin is located only a 10 minute drive from the hub of Sooke. It’s built on an acreage with stunning views off of the trails. You’re welcome to walk the trail at the back of the cabin and explore the rear of the property. Charlies Cabin is located alongside Sooke Road. Giving easy access to the main road to drive to nearby restaurants, stores, beaches and more. It's a true cabin feel with accessibility to the roadway. There is also a Fireplace & Outdoor Fire pit.
neighborhood_overview:
Sooke and it's surrounding areas are breathtaking. Head down to the sandy beaches of Aylard farms in East Sooke. Or a wonderful hike up Mt. Quimper From a walk to Mystic or China beach, and over to the Sombrio beach waterfall. Walking out through Avatar grove seeing trees from 500 to 1000 years old, or taking a stroll through Botanical beaches unreal landscape. From Local kayaking tours to a ziplining park just down the road. East Sooke park has extraordinary white sandy beaches, and great views of the bay, it's just a 10 minute drive away.

We've got lots of local cafes specifically Stick in the mud coffee, which is made in house with hand roasted beans. There's an astounding atmosphere of beautiful people. With a charm about this place that'll make you fall in love. Lots of local stores and markets. From food, to home made gifts, and more. And or if you like the Classic Tim Hortons, Mcdonalds or Serious Coffee we've go that too.

We Have local brewery's, winery
host_about: I'm here to make your stay as comfortable and accommodating as possible. I've got a lot of experience in the hospitality industry. I also work in the film realm of things whilst running Charlies Cabin. This gives me lots of versatility and the ability to put more time in to your stay with us. I've lived in Sooke my whole life, yet traveled the world and have seen so much. But there's no place like home. I'm a walking database for this little town, with lots of tips and secrets spots. Here to help in your every need. I’ll always respond quickly to guests, in regards to whatever it may be.

name: Ocean View Country house One month minimum stay
description:
The house sits on a large lot in a quiet neighbourhood, it has a west facing exposure and great views over the ocean and mountains.
It is very comfortable with a wood burning fireplace in the living room.
The kitchen has a vaulted ceiling and is equipped with stainless steel appliances, granite countertops and a large island.
The master bedroom has a master ensuite bathroom. The other 2 bedrooms share the second bathroom.
The location is perfect for getting to the ferries and to the airport.
neighborhood_overview: There is well stocked corner store with a deli and coffee on hand which is approximately a 20 minute walk from here. Pickle ball and tennis courts are also close by.
host_about: My husband and I are both recently retired from teaching and physiotherapy and ready now for a new phase of life. We would like to welcome guests to our house as we have the space and time to do it and we really enjoy meeting new people.We are both outdoor enthusiasts and are only steps from the ocean where we often go down and either swim or canoe, and meet with the neighbours for a picnic supper while watching the beautiful sunsets. We are happy to advise you on all the possible activities you can do in this area.

name: Beautiful family-friendly heritage home
description:
Feel like a local in this beautifully restored heritage home, just steps to the Gorge waterway, Banfield Park, cafes and bakeries. You'll love this centrally located and family-friendly neighbourhood just a 10 minute bike, bus or drive from downtown Victoria.

NOTE: This rental is for animal lovers only! We offer a below-market nightly rate and ask our guests to care for our two kitties while staying in our home. This home also has many stairs.

City of Victoria License Number 00038142
neighborhood_overview: You will love the neighbourhood, with the beautiful Gorge waterway just steps away. In Banfield park, you'll find great walking paths, a fantastic playground and a public dock - the water is warmer in the Gorge than many of the lakes nearby and is great for swimming! In the summer you can walk across the Selkirk Trestle and rent kayaks or stand up paddle boards. Seals, sea otters, herons, and a variety of ducks can frequently be spotted in the Gorge. You're less than a five minute walk to famous Fry's Bakery and Spiral Cafe, which has a laid back vibe and often has live music. Some great restaurants and breweries are within a pleasant 20 minute walk, including Spinnakers, Glo, Thai Green Elephant, Brown's Crafthouse, Moon Underwater Brewery and Lighthouse Brewery.
host_about:
Dave and I have two young daughters and feel lucky to call Victoria home. We've been opening our doors to fellow travellers since we joined Airbnb in 2012 and have had nothing but wonderful experiences with the guests we've welcomed into our home. We think it gives people a more local experience of the city, and has helped to offset the cost of our own adventures!

Victoria is a fantastic place to live, and British Columbia makes for a spectacular backyard. We fell in love with the west coast after moving here from Ontario almost two decades ago. When at home, you'll find us getting around by bicycle and getting our hands dirty with gardening and caring for our backyard chickens. 

During the daytime, I am an urban planner and Dave is a transportation engineer... making sure nobody gets stuck at too many red lights on their way across town!

name: Downtown Gem Sleeps 6 near Inner Harbour w/Parking
description:
Retreat in style at our modern, sunlit 2-bedroom, 2-bath condo in downtown Victoria! With over 500 sq. ft. of outdoor space across two balconies, find your perfect spot for morning coffee or evening relaxation. Explore Victoria's diverse dining, shopping & Inner Harbour delights.
Park your car in the secure covered parking space while you experience the best of downtown Victoria on foot!
This unit has all the amenities and finishing touches to make your stay both comfortable and memorable!
neighborhood_overview:
Our charming Airbnb is centrally located in downtown Victoria and easy walking distance to all the major attractions:

1. Miniature World - View detailed dioramas with historical and fantasy scenes. (4-min walk)

2. Royal BC Museum - Discover BC's history, culture, and nature. (7-min walk)

3. Whale Watching (Prince of Whales Whale & Marine) - See Vancouver Island’s massive marine creatures in action (7-min walk)

4. High Tea at the Empress Hotel - Experience elegance over tea at Victoria's iconic Empress Hotel (8-min walk)

5. Inner Harbour - Watch buskers, enjoy waterfront views, and see Parliament Buildings. (9-min walk)

6. BC Parliament Buildings - Admire architecture, lawns, and the summer light show. (10-min walk)

7. Market Square - One of Victoria's most unique shopping areas, mixed of over 30 retailers consisting of one-of-a-kind boutiques, restaurants, and services (11-min walk)

8. Chinatown - E

name: STUNNING HOME WITH AMAZING VIEWS NEAR THE CITY
description:
OWNERS PRIMARY RESIDENCE. Waiting on Licence Number.

Enjoy a lovely staycation in this large home. Enjoy a morning coffee overlooking acres of dense forest and the valley from the top of Triangle Mountain.

Located just a short drive from downtown Victoria, you'll have easy access to a wide range of attractions and activities.

Whether you're visiting Victoria for a family vacation or a group getaway, our adorable house offers the perfect blend of comfort, convenience, and coastal charm.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located on top of triangle mountain near the thriving city of Langford which offers everything anyone would need for a very comfortable stay.

A short 5min drive away to all amenities, Belmont Market includes groceries, shopping centre, restaurants, movie theatre and more.

This place feels very private yet downtown Victoria is only 20 - 25 minutes away.

Conveniently located for a day trip to the Canadian west coast’s most breath taking beaches ( China Beach, French Beach, Mystic Beach )

If you enjoy hiking the city of Langford is surrounded by dozens of wonderful trails.
host_about:
Hello! We are a young, busy, entrepreneurial family living near Victoria, BC. We have both lived in the Westshore for over 20 years and are happy to call Langford, BC our home. We have 4 boys and have raised them from babies to teenagers in the area, so we are happy to share our favourite local activities while on your travels. 

We like to travel with our family and stay at Air BnBs wherever we go. From our experience travelling, we strive to make Wild Summit Vacation Home as family friendly and comfortable as possible while you and your family are visiting. 

Our house is conveniently 25 minutes away from downtown Victoria, while offering a multitude of activities close by, so you never need to leave the Westshore. Hiking, trails, lakes, beaches, local sports games, are a few of our favourite things to do. 

We hope you enjoy your stay at Wild Summit Vacation Home!

name: Great family getaway: clean, comfortable, charming
description: Welcome to our home on the hill. You'll enjoy lots of natural light, a private, treed yard and views of the Olympic Mountains from the deck. It's the perfect place for families visiting Victoria for short or long term stays. The house is located in a quiet, safe residential neighbourhood, close to beaches, parks, playgrounds, golf courses, Mt. Tolmie, groceries and shopping. It's a 10 min drive to downtown and 350m from major bus routes.
neighborhood_overview:
North Jubilee/Camosun is a beautiful residential neighborhood. From here you can quickly and easily access downtown but also enjoy being in close proximity to quaint communities, retail districts and outdoor destinations. Seeing neighbourhood deer is a common occurrence.

The house is a seven minute walk from Allenby Park and a 12 minute walk from Carnarvon Water Park, great playgrounds for kids.

Charelli's delicatessen is six blocks away and makes the best picnic baskets ever. Within a 30 minute walking distance you'll find Estevan Village, Oak Bay Ave, Willows beach, Uplands Park and Cattle Point ocean front view point. Estevan Village and Oak Bay Village have great cafes, restaurants, farm market/grocery stores, local ice cream and gelato, bookstores, fish and chips shop and boutique shopping.

There are beautiful neighbourhoods to wander with lovely character homes and established gardens spread throughout. Mt. Tolmie park is a 25 minute walk away a
host_about:
Give me a great kitchen, good friends, access to nature, music, and a healthy supply of wine and I shall be one happy pup.

Life is meant to be enjoyed, not endured.

I try to take in as much life as I can while still being a contributing member of society. That somehow allots plenty of fun spread through all that work. Whether its a simple camping trip, potluck, or hike with dog, everyone needs to find whats right for them. No one person is exactly the same, go find yours.

My life motto is: "If you have a problem and you cant do anything about it, dont worry, because that's not going to do much aside from stress you out. If its a problem you can fix, then dont worry, because you can fix it."

neighborhood_overview:
Victoria is a sophisticated gem of timeless quality, named for one of history’s most remarkable women. With a temperate climate and British Colonial heritage, Victoria is a perfect destination year-round. Sights include the world-famous Butchart Gardens, Royal British Columbia Museum and the amazing Victoria Butterfly Gardens. Stroll through Goldstream park where salmon spawn, eagles fly and waterfalls cascade down cliffs. After a full day, head back to the resort to linger over tea. The rooms are angled to maximize water views, and the fireplace will keep you cozy as you look out over the moonlit bay.

The Butchart Gardens
Located on an expansive country estate, the 55-acre gardens feature floral displays, meandering paths and expansive lawns. 15 mi.

name: #104 Parkcrest Dr - 3 Bedroom Upper Suite in House
description:
We are required by law to rent our properties for a minimum of 91 nights. Please take this into consideration when choosing your reservation dates.

Hello, I'm Don Ohlgren, owner of Be My Guest in BC!

This gorgeous updated 3-bedroom upper suite in a house on Parkcrest Dr is right by the forest and Craigflower Creek, which runs right through the backyard!
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located on Parkcrest Drive in the View Royal area. It's a beautiful suburban area with Craigflower Creek running right through the backyard!

- Victoria General Hospital is a 5 minute drive away.
- The E&N Rail Trail, a multi-use pedestrian / bike path, is less than a 10 minute walk away. It runs downtown in one direction, and merges with the Galloping Goose Trail & Lochside Trail that runs all the way up to Sidney, and it also merges with the Galloping Goose Trail that goes out to Langford, Metchosin, Sooke, and beyond! It's a great trail for biking adventures & day trips.
- View Royal Park (with a playground) is less than a 15 minute walk away.
- Four Mile House Restaurant is less than a 5 minute drive away.
- Highland Pacific Golf Course is less than a 5 minute drive away.
- Stewart Beach and Thetis Cove are both less than a 10 minute drive away with beautiful waterfront scenery.
- Admirals Walk Shopping Centre is less than a 10 m
host_about:
Hi! I’m Don Ohlgren, owner of Be My Guest in BC. 

Over the past 20 years, it's been my privilege to manage my own and other privately owned properties. I currently manage 35+ properties in & around Victoria, BC. 

These vary from one bedroom suites up to eight bedroom executive mansions.
My own staff do all our cleaning and maintenance and I guarantee you a perfect stay – every time.

So whether you are looking for a long-term executive stay, a short-term holiday stay, emergency housing, or a work assignment for a few months, I know I can find the perfect place for you.

I love welcoming my guests to Canada’s beautiful garden city and I look forward to exceeding your expectations!

See you soon,  
- Don Ohlgren

This will be without a doubt one of your highlights of your Vancouver Island journey and an exceptional experience as an intimate family gathering or corporate retreat you will be eager to share with your family and friends.

Steeped in nature this expansive South-West facing estate neighbours a rain forest that is home to trees dating back over 700 years. Parties and events are considered
neighborhood_overview:
The Sea Lion is 15 minutes past Sooke BC, this little town is fully equipped with anything you may require. Shopping, restaurants, fishing.

You are also very close the Shirley, where we highly recommend checking out! They have great food.

If you choose to explore, as we highly recommend you do, the beaches, trails, wildlife and rugged west coast will amaze you! China beach, Sandcut beach, Port Renfrew and botanical beach are just a few in the local area.
host_about:

I hope you enjoy the home as much as me and my family do!

Lenny

name: Beach Camp Cabin, steps from the beach!
description: Enjoy the peaceful surroundings of Port Renfrew and the San Juan Harbour from our conveniently located cottage. Take a stroll on the beach and witness the raw beauty and wild nature that this area has to offer. For outdoor enthusiasts, enjoy world class fishing, surfing and hiking - access to the Juan de Fuca and West Coast Trail is located here. Or explore the ancient forests and stand among some of the largest remaining trees in North America.
neighborhood_overview:
Conveniently located in Beach Camp we are steps from the beach and surf break. The General Store and the Pacific Gateway Marina which houses Bridgemans pub is a short walk away, and for those travelling with children, we are situated directly across from the playground. The library is also within walking distance.
Port Renfrew Pub, Botanical Beach, Avatar Grove and several other surf breaks including Sombrio are a short drive away.

name: #105 Gordon Head Rd - 3 Bed Upper Gorgeous Suite
description:
We are required by law to rent our properties for a minimum of 91 nights. Please take this into consideration when choosing your reservation dates.

Hello, I'm Don Ohlgren, owner of Be My Guest in BC!

This huge 3-bedroom suite in a house on Gordon Head Rd (very close to UVic / University of Victoria) is perfect for larger groups. It's quite centrally located, just minutes away from Shelbourne Avenue with its several malls, restaurants, pubs / bars, and entertainment centers. Many Victoria attr
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located on Gordon Head Rd, near UVic. It's a short drive to everything, and quite close to the ocean and several beaches.

- The University of Victoria (UVic) is less than a 5 minute drive away.
- Montague Park (with playground) is less than a 10 minute walk away.
- Township Coffee is less than a 5 minute drive away, and is a delightful local coffee / tea / snack joint with the friendliest, most welcoming staff.
- Tuscany Village and University Heights Mall is less than a 5 minute drive away with restaurants, grocery, and other shopping options.
- Hillside Mall is less than a 10 minute drive away with more shopping outlets, restaurants, and more.
- Henderson Golf Course is less than a 5 minute drive away.
- Mt Douglas Golf Course is less than a 10 minute drive away.
- Mt Douglas is less than a 10 minute drive away, and features many hiking trails and an awesome summit to drive or hike up to!
- Willows Beach, Cadboro Bay Be
host_about:
Hi! I’m Don Ohlgren, owner of Be My Guest in BC. 

Over the past 20 years, it's been my privilege to manage my own and other privately owned properties. I currently manage 35+ properties in & around Victoria, BC. 

These vary from one bedroom suites up to eight bedroom executive mansions.
My own staff do all our cleaning and maintenance and I guarantee you a perfect stay – every time.

So whether you are looking for a long-term executive stay, a short-term holiday stay, emergency housing, or a work assignment for a few months, I know I can find the perfect place for you.

I love welcoming my guests to Canada’s beautiful garden city and I look forward to exceeding your expectations!

See you soon,  
- Don Ohlgren

description:

Two Bedroom Penthouse: Queen in master, queen in second bedroom, queen Murphy bed in living area. Private Hot tub on deck. Maximum occupancy 6.
neighborhood_overview:
Victoria is a sophisticated gem of timeless quality, named for one of history’s most remarkable women. With a temperate climate and British Colonial heritage, Victoria is a perfect destination year-round. Sights include the world-famous Butchart Gardens, Royal British Columbia Museum and the amazing Victoria Butterfly Gardens. Stroll through Goldstream park where salmon spawn, eagles fly and waterfalls cascade down cliffs. After a full day, head back to the resort to linger over tea. The rooms are angled to maximize water views, and the fireplace will keep you cozy as you look out over the moonlit bay.

Popular Attractions
The Butchart Gardens
Located on an expansive country estate, the 55-acre gardens feature floral displays, meandering paths and expansive lawns. 15 mi.

Royal BC Museum and IMAX Theatre
Learn about the human and natural history of British Columbia through exciting exhibits at the Royal BC Museum. The museum also features the 400-seat

name: Ocean Breeze Cottage, Peaceful, Renovated +Nr Town
description: Looking for an affordable, clean, rural retreat within sight of the ocean for a few days? Then you’ve found it.  Ocean Breeze Cottage on Salt Spring Island is newly renovated, & sleeps up to 6.  You get the whole place to yourselves.  All within easy reach of Ganges Village and local beaches and lakes.  Your own private sanctuary, with indoor-outdoor living.  And new modern appliances: range, fridge, washer-dryer, and a well-equipped kitchen.  Some breakfast basics and fixings are also included.
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 4-minute drive from Ganges Village, the main centre of Salt Spring. We are on a quiet local road which runs parallel to the coast and you can see glimpses of the ocean from the property.

You can take a gentle stroll along our tranquil road, or, if you are more energetic, we are only a few minutes drive from several hiking trails.

Ample parking is available for 2-3 vehicles.
host_about:
My family and I have lived on Salt Spring after moving from Vancouver in 2007.  We enjoy kayaking, sailing and hiking among other pursuits.  We are remote workers, owning an elearning business (www.sparkandco.ca) and 2 international properties in Mexico (www.oceanbreezeakumal.com) and Panama.

We're grateful to be able to offer others the opportunity to visit and explore our beautiful island by staying in a our guest cottage.

name: Spacious Suite in Modernized Garden Character Home
description: Stay in a beautiful Victoria character home 10 min from downtown! Located in Esquimalt close to a vibrant village with all desired amenities (5 minute walk away). NOTE: Right next to large construction project with building noise and limited parking during the day from 7am-5pm. Bus from the house to downtown in 12-15 minutes. The space includes a spacious open concept style living with 2 queen beds, 1 sofa bed, full kitchen, bathroom with towels & amenities, patio, garden and keypad access!
neighborhood_overview:
Esquimalt Village is a vibrant and developing community with access to local grocery stores , coffee shops, restaurants, gas, liquor, transit and more! Red Barn Market is 2 min from the house and has everything to satisfy your fresh grocery needs. There is a Tim Hortons (a Canadian favorite), La Bella Patatte (local eatery), Saigon Char-Broil (asian cuisine), and Country Grocer in the main Village. It also includes a fitness center, skating rink and sports field (Bullin Park) if you are looking for some exercise.

The house is located in a developing area and note that there is large construction projects happening within the same block. If you are sensitive to external noise from construction during the day (7am-530pm), then consider your booking carefully. See Esquimalt new developments and future city plans at Aragon (aragon.ca).

Let us know if you need any other tips on the neighbourhood!
host_about:
My name is Patrick, and our team at CleanHost look forward to being your Airbnb host! With 15 years of hospitality experience, we design our spaces with your comfort and experience in mind. We focus on providing our guests with comfortable accommodation with a high focus on value and cleanliness. We ensure fresh linens and a sanitized space for every new guest. We look forward to hosting you and giving you a great guest experience!

Patrick

West Coast inspired home. Garden paradise. Peacefully surrounded by wildlife, located a short walk to surfing, fishing, beaches, parks+trails!

*No noise in hot tub or fire pit after 10 pm*

$80 Pet fee for up to two dogs

Open concept home features vaulted ceilings, log beams, wood burning fireplace, private 2 acre lot at the end of a quiet no-through road. Main level w/2 beds+1 bath. Loft style master bedroom w/en suite. Back deck hot tub to star gaze while listening to the roar of the ocean on one side and the creek along the other. Loads of parking.

cozy living room with fireplace

We have 5 adult children (son & wife in Chicago, son in Surrey BC, daughter in Delta BC, Daughter & partner in Victoria BC, son in Victoria BC), and our great joy, a grandson in Grade 4.

name: Bā Fú: Elevated ocean view suite with outdoor pool
description:
Welcome to Bā Fú, luxury accomodation in the sky. This 17th floor two-bed / two-bath unit is situated in one of Victoria's premiere condo buildings, The Falls.

From the moment you enter, you will count your blessings. Jaw dropping panoramic views to the south-west over the Fairmont Empress, BC Legislature, Inner Harbour, and Juan de Fuca straight.

Everything you need for your vacation in Downtown Victoria. Enjoy year round comfort being one of the very few with Air Conditioning!
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartment is within walking distance to a variety of fantastic restaurants, cafes, and shops, as well as popular tourist attractions like the BC Legislature, Fairmont Empress Hotel, Royal BC Museum and the Victoria Bug Zoo.

Ten minutes walk to Beacon Hill Park or Chinatown.

In the evening, you can enjoy a leisurely stroll along the picturesque waterfront, taking in the lively street performers and gorgeous sunsets.
host_about:
Canadian who spends his time on the West Coast of beautiful British Columbia.  I'm active, neat, punctual, and respectful of others. I love to share my extensive knowledge of Southern Vancouver Island and why it's one of the best places on earth! 

I have a degree in Economics from the University of Victoria. My interests include investing, asian cuisine, dachshunds, and travelling. 

I'm a seasoned global traveller, 23 countries & counting, and I’m professional airline points collector & redeemer. Hawaii over 20 times. Europe over 10 times, visiting a vast array of countries. I've travelled to mainland China 3 times. I've lived in Sydney, Australia for 9 months.

Stunning 3 bedroom plus (very comfy sofa bed & air mattress on request) and 2.5 bathroom home is newly renovated and minutes from Starlight Stadium.
5 Beds total.

neighborhood_overview:
A 2-block walk to the region's famous Galloping Goose Trail, 10 minutes from Goldstream Provincial Park, and 15 minutes to multiple local beaches and dozens of hiking trails. You're also only 5 minutes from multiple shopping centers, the YMCA, and West hills Starlight Rugby Center. All this, plus you're conveniently located a short drive from downtown Victoria, while being enough past the hustle-bustle of the city to make slipping up-island a breeze. Victoria offers more restaurants per capita than anywhere in Canada.

name: Wildwood Rainforest Retreat: Jordan River Cabin
description: A wonderful slice of West Coast heaven. Enjoy this beautiful log cabin nestled in the rainforest. Great base for hiking, surfing or beachcombing adventures in southern Vancouver Island. Features: Self check in, 2 bedrooms with queen beds. Full kitchen, dining area and bathroom, washer and dryer, Wi-fi, Smart TV and landline. Cozy wood burning stove. Covered deck and charcoal grill. Private yard and plenty of parking. Wildlife viewing opportunities in a private natural setting.
neighborhood_overview: The cabin is peacefully surrounded by the rainforest, hiking trails, wildlife, beaches, parks and fishing. Enjoy the world-renowned surfing at China Beach, Jordan River, Mystic Beach and Somberio Beach. There are also ATV trails for the adrenaline junkies. The historic BC Hydro Dam is a short drive away.  Jordan River was originally a logging community and much of its quiet charm remains.
host_about: I was born and raised on the Island and live here with my family and faithful dog, Daisy. I've enjoyed travelling to interesting spots through AirBnb and so very much look forward to hosting you at the cabin.

name: San Juan Surf and Stay 2024
description:
Welcome to San Juan Surf and Stay, a rustic home away from home along the shores of the Pacific ocean. Whether you're seeking a peaceful escape or an adventure by the sea, our seaside retreat offers the perfect setting for a great trip.
Our coastal gem is located in Port Renfrew, a tranquil &undiscovered treasure of the coast. The house is steps away from the San Juan River and the Pacific Ocean, allowing you to wake up to the soothing sound of the waves. *EXEMPT FROM BC AIRBNB RESTRICTIONS*
neighborhood_overview:
On the unceded territory of the Pacheedat First Nation, the San Juan Surf and Stay is located in Port Renfrew, BC at the mouth of the San Juan River, in the Beach Camp Neighbourhood.
Our street is a quiet cul-de-sac which offers a serene getaway while staying close to town. Our home is walking distance to both South Pacheedat Beach and Beach Camp Beach. A few steps further you will find the Bridgemans Marina and Pub, where you can a restaurant and Boat Launch/Slips (with short term moorage rates!)

neighborhood_overview:
Located in a the Wild Coast Cottage community. There are neighbours close by. Privacy may be limited in outdoor areas.

Please note that each cottage in the neighbourhood is privately owned. If you visit at another cottage and bring dishes, chairs etc. please be sure to return them to their original cottage. Some cottages are rented like ours, but most are used only by their owners and families. Please be respectful of their privacy and property.


If you don’t feel like cooking The Renfrew Pub, Bridgeman’s West Coast Eatery, Coastal Kitchen Café and Tomi’s Home Cooking are all a short walk away.

The local General Store is about a 1km walk along Parkinson Rd and has a small selection of groceries, beer, wine and a cash machine. It’s a good idea to stock up on groceries on your way to Port Renfrew either in Sooke on your way from Victoria or in Lake Cowichan.

The list of activities in Port Renfrew are endless; seeing some of Canada’s t
host_about:
Ken and Joy embarked on the journey of purchasing Handsome Dan’s from Handsome Dan and The French Girl in the summer of 2020 amongst all the chaos of covid-19. 

They were looking for a business they could call their own and benefit from all their hard work and ideas instead of seeing CEO’s and upper office management always reaping the rewards, while telling other managers and workers they needed to cut back, or there were no bonuses for the year. 

The journey here was not easy - they spent 6 months apart while trying to sell their house in Saskatchewan, and then in late April 2021 they got some wonderful news - their current tenant insurer in BC said they would cover a landlord policy for a house in SK. 

In May 2021 Ken gave away or had to throw away 98% of the household items they had collected over the years - since they were moving from a huge house in SK just over 3000 sq ft with an extra wide 2 car garage into a less than 650 sq. Ft basement suite in BC. 

The transition of purchasing Handsome Dan’s and moving halfway across the country during a pandemic none the less wasn’t the easiest but they got through and now they are excited to expand and build Handsome Dan’s vacation rental property management in Port Renfrew and across the island to help cottage owners see a return on their investment, and for guests to have an amazing experience from the time they book their vacation till the time they leave; and even after raving about the experience they had at a Handsome Dan property. 

Port Renfrew is a favourite destination for a day or overnight trip on Vancouver Island. Each visit, no matter what time of year you are consumed by the natural majesty of this little community and the breath taking earthly beauty that surrounds it. 

We invite you to stay in our cottages and enjoy a few days, or weeks any time of the year. There is much to do and see. Or simply do nothing for extended periods of time, but sit quietly and listen to the ocean.  All of the cottages are privately owned and decorated to the taste of the owners.  We invite you to check them  out and are excited to share this special place with you.

name: ♨ Cedar Coast Lodge - Coastal retreat  w/ HOT TUB
description:
✨ WINTER 2024 PROMO RATES!✨

Escape the city and reconnect with nature at Cedar Coast Lodge, a serene retreat located moments from French Beach - the perfect base for your island adventures.

An authentic west coast experience awaits you at this stunning 2,500 sq. ft. cedar home nestled in the trees, with over 2.5 acres of land to enjoy. Complete with hot tub, indoor fireplace, wraparound decks, expansive lawns, reading library, BBQ, fully-equipped kitchen, fire pit and more!
neighborhood_overview:
The Lodge is a 1 minute drive away from French Beach, 2 min from Stoked Wood Fired Pizzeria, and 5 min from scrumptious Shirley Delicious.

This area is simply stunning - there are plenty of hikes, beaches and forests for you to explore, as well as adrenaline activities galore, like whale-watching, fishing, kayaking, surfing, windsurfing or kiteboarding.

Also plenty opportunities for bird and wildlife watching - spot pods of dolphins, orcas, sea lions, whales or seals. Be on the lookout for bald eagles, local bunnies at The Lodge, herons, canadian geese and river otters.

Or just take in the majestic beach sunsets, views of the Olympic Mountains and general beauty of the Straight of Juan de Fuca.

No matter the season, the wild west coast and Cedar Coast Lodge has something beautiful in store!

HIGHLIGHTS:
- French Beach (1 min): picnic tables, beachside campfire rings, kids playgound, surfing
- Point no Point (2 min): del

name: Connected Hearts Home B&B on Lovely Pender Island
description:
Welcome to "Connected Hearts Home"!!
Pender Island is the most southern of the Gulf Islands, conveniently accessible from both Vancouver and Victoria via ferry.
This is a clean, spacious family home nestled in a private setting, surrounded by beautiful nature. We are in walking distance to numerous trails and majestic views.
This home feels like summer camp in the most beautiful place in the world.
You'll have the cottage experience, while staying in a beautiful home.
neighborhood_overview:
Pender Island Golf & Country Club
Golf Disc Park
Mount Norman
Driftwood Centre for ALL of your amenities
Liquor Store open until 10pm at Medicine Beach
Front yard sunrises and backyard sunsets
Beautiful lake across the road and ocean views and ocean accesses are all in walking distance
Gulf Island Reserve Natural Park
Port Browning Marina
Pender Island Kayak Adventures
Saturday Farmer's Market
AND ohhhh so many hiking trails!

Hey!

name: Luxury family home steps from the ocean
description: Beautifully appointed designer home in south Oak Bay. This newly built (2020) home has everything you need to unwind and enjoy everything that Victoria has to offer. This centrally located home is less than 10 mins driving to downtown Victoria, one block from the ocean, and a short stroll to Oak Bay Village.
neighborhood_overview:
South Oak Bay is one of the nicest residential areas in Victoria. This walkable seaside community has a number of local attractions that make it top destination for visitors to Victoria. Directly across the street you’ll find De’lish Cafe, one of the finest bakeries in Victoria. We are also just steps away from Oak Bay Village, a boutique shopping district with an eclectic mix of clothing stores, book stores, coffee shops, restaurants, a local pub (Penny Farthing), and a famous Italian delicatessen (Ottavios). There are also lots of walking trails to explore right from your doorstep. The closest beach, McNeil Bay, is only a 5 min walk and is part of the Marine Scenic Route, a trail system which connects the many beaches along Victoria’s shoreline.

If you’re up for a view, there are many local options including Anderson Hill, a beautiful park that that is just a 10 min walk away that provides panoramic views of the Olympic Mountains and the Salish Sea’s Juan de Fuca and Haro

description:
Welcome to The Lake Cottage! Enjoy this sunny, beautifully furnished home with lake views and a private yard – only 5 minutes from Salt Spring's Ganges town center and our famous Saturday Market, with views of gorgeous Cusheon Lake across the road.

This rare gem, ideally situated for lake fun just a 5 minute walk to public dock. It's perfect for families and groups.
Newly renovated kitchen and Bathrooms (2024). Fresh and airy. Simple minimalist design while feeling cozy. 2 hammocks to lounge.
neighborhood_overview: We are across the street from Cusheon Lake (the public access dock for swimming is a few minutes up the road). Beautiful Beddis Beach is a 5 minute drive away, to the east. Ganges town center is a 5 minute drive to the north. We're ideally situated mid-island, accessible to ferries and all the best that Salt Spring has to offer!

name: Forest Cottage & Sauna w/ Ocean & Mountain Views
description:
Welcome to Bellwoods Cottage B&B on Salt Spring Island. (IG @stayatbellwoods)

Enjoy our west coast cottage with spectacular hilltop views overlooking the Gulf Islands and the Coast Mountain Ranges. The cottage is privately situated on 5 acres of wooded land, bordered by Peter Arnell Park and trails leading to nature reserves at the bottom of the hill.

This 2-bedroom 1-bath can sleep up to 6 people. A perfect place for couples, friends, and families to rest and explore the island.
neighborhood_overview: Bellwoods Cottage is nestled next to Peter Arnell Park with direct access to hiking trails and connections to nature reserves. The home is on a private driveway shared with two other friendly neighbors, though you wouldn't know it as the entire place feels private. The mid-island property is near Stowel Lake and Quarry Rock farms, Beddis Beach and Cusheon Lake, and the popular Salt Spring Cheese.
host_about: We're life enthusiasts. If you need recommendations for must-see / must-do / must-eat spots on the island, we've got you covered.

name: "Above It All" Guest House in rural Victoria
description: "Above It All" guest house is perched on a ridge showcasing unparalleled 270 degree views with vivid sunrises and soft sunsets. Views between 2 mountain ranges. Come experience the beauty of creation. Generous rooms are filled with light from oversized windows each with a view beyond. Centrally located on southern Vancouver Island, 20 min to Greater Victoria and the Cowichan Valley where daily adventures await. Wigglesworth Lake, the Trans-Canada and Sooke Hills Wilderness trails are close by.
neighborhood_overview: There are hiking trails and a small, clear lake within walking distance. There are many trails, places of interest and lakes nearby. Check out the Kinsol Trestle or the waterfall in Goldstream Park. If you are here in the fall experience a salmon run. Watch hummingbirds in the garden area, eagles soaring and birds bathing. Deer walk thru the property grazing on the foliage. Come experience the beauty of nature.

description:

Please note that we are one of the few houses in JR that is zoned for short term rentals (STR) and not impacted by the BC Government's new STR legislation.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in Trailhead Landing in Jordan River, a strata subdivision with 15 houses located on a 2 acre lot. Please respect the locals, many of whom live here full time. Please be kind and considerate of their quiet time.

Please note we are not a house for parties of any kind. While we are happy to welcome groups of 6 we ask that no guests visit the house and absolutely no loud parties to help respect our neighbour’s privacy

A perfect base for exploring the area, or just relaxing and restoring.
neighborhood_overview: It is a strange and quirky kind of neighbourhood - industrial meets schools meets trailer park / cute old vacation homes from the 60s  - people are generally both very friendly and respectful and also mind their own business - my fave combo!

name: The Waterfront CaBen
description: The perfect rustic getaway. The CaBen is a charming wooden cabin with breathtaking oceanside views and original brass-finish fireplace. Only a few minutes commute from the Fulford Harbour ferry stop; it’s an easy drive, bike or bus to your retreat and private beach. Nestled between ancient Douglas firs, your stay will be perfect blend of tree house meets seaside tranquility. Relax, recharge, reconnect (or even work remotely if you need to). Your CaBen adventure awaits!
neighborhood_overview:
The CaBen is located in the Fulford harbour area.
Fulford Harbour is on the southern end of Salt Spring Island, BC, and about 20 minutes south of Ganges. It is mostly residential but has a gas station and grocery store, a restaurant, an art gallery, a marina, and a BC Ferries terminal with sailings to Swartz Bay on Vancouver Island. Victoria is about a 45 minute drive from the Swartz Bay ferry terminal.

name: Port Renfrew Oceanfront Retreat
description:
Escape to the Wild West Coast in Port Renfrew!
Stay, play, and relax at our ocean front vacation rental. Situated on the rugged west coast of Southern Vancouver Island, our oceanfront retreat is perched above the ocean, right on the water’s edge.
Port Renfrew offers first class fishing, beaches, surfing, hiking and moutain biking. As well as endless scenic beauty, spectacular marine and wildlife viewing, roaring surf and nearby lakes and rivers. Guests can experience access to uniquely rich tide pools and shoreline trails with fantastic geological features for the beach adventurer. Hike through majestic old-growth forests. Book a fishing charter. Surf or kitesurf the waves. Or simply cook up a good meal on the bbq with a beverage on the deck as you enjoy a spectacular ocean view. Maybe catch a stunning sunset while you cozy up to an outdoor gas fire!
Take a quick stroll to Gateway Marina and maybe catch a glimpse of the salmon, halibut and crab caught fresh that d
host_about: We are avid travelers. We have spent time traveling throughout Canada, US, Mexico and South East Asia. We want to see and experience as much as we can in this lifetime. We enjoy being in the outdoors hiking, paddle boarding, camping and boating. We own two vacation properties. One in Nanoose, British Columbia and the other in Port Renfrew, British Columbia. We look forward to sharing them with you.

name: Alfred  House - Ruckle Heritage Farm
description: The Alfred Ruckle House is a Victorian style Heritage home from 1900's on a working farm inside Ruckle Provincial Park.  Set off the road with private drive & large fenced yard.  Step into our time capsule farmhouse.  You have the entire period home including four rooms in the upstairs can be rented to one group, sharing the upstairs bathroom.  This accommodation provides use of the kitchen and outdoor BBQ & furniture. Includes 3/4 acre fenced yard.  EV charger at your host's home available.
neighborhood_overview: You will be staying inside Ruckle Provincial Park with all the the trails and shoreline vistas it offers.  You are inside a unique working heritage farm, with the fields and animals part of your viewscape.  There is a seasonal farm stand at the corner.  Rock Salt Cafe in Fulford Villiage only 10 min drive, also nearby take-away food at The Woodshed. The Cheesefarm & many other farm stands enroute.
host_about: Mike has been Ruckle Farm’s manager since 1990, and Marjorie joined the effort in 1999. We worked the farm on behalf of the last of the Ruckle family. Since their tenure ended we are under contract with BC Parks

name: Sooke Harbour Haven
description: Located on the ocean in beautiful Sooke where the "Rainforest meets the Sea".   Take in ocean views from either balcony while enjoying a meal or relaxing. Our Haven is located between downtown Sooke and Whiffen Spit - a five minute drive will bring you to central Sooke’s restaurants, shops, and breweries. The same drive in the opposite direction brings you to Whiffen Spit, a lovely accessible trail with harbour and ocean views.

-Sooke Potholes

name: The Perfectly Peaceful Wildflower house
description: Enjoy the blissful tranquility of the Wildflower House, year round!  Come and refresh while relaxing in our masterfully updated cottage style home. You will be immediately removed from your busy life the moment you step foot on our property.  The home boasts 3 bedrooms and 2 updated bathrooms. There will be plenty of space outdoor to relax, either in the new 8 person cedar sauna, the firepit or at the large 8- 10 person outdoor dining table where you’ll get ocean glimpses and magical sunsets. 😊
neighborhood_overview:
The Wildflower house is conveniently located close to the Vesuvius area in an extremely quite neighbourhood with quaint roads for strolling/running.
It is the perfect spot to kick back and relax while listening to the birds.
host_about:
Hey there,

We are Aaron, Angie, Aeson & Akai..also known as the A-Team!  We’re a fun loving homeschool family of four.
After spending the past decade in the Okanagan, we have set down roots here on beautiful Salt Spring Island.  Being born and raised on Vancouver Island, we are all very happy to be back by the ocean.  Our family loves to spend our time outdoors... Gardening, hiking, fishing, camping, hanging at the beach and exploring all the amazing places the west coast has to offer.  It has been our dream for years to host a unique space of our own and we hope you love what we’ve created as much as we do!

description:
The entire house is for rent, with 4 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms, very recently built!

The house is in an unbeatable location near Royal Jubilee Hospital and just minutes to downtown inner harbour. Carnarvon Water Park is just a few blocks away. The property is also right on a major bike route that leads straight downtown in one direction, and the other direction takes you right to the big, beautiful & sandy Willows Beach in Oak Bay.
host_about:
Hi! I’m Don Ohlgren, owner of Be My Guest in BC. 

Over the past 20 years, it's been my privilege to manage my own and other privately owned properties. I currently manage 35+ properties in & around Victoria, BC. 

These vary from one bedroom suites up to eight bedroom executive mansions.
My own staff do all our cleaning and maintenance and I guarantee you a perfect stay – every time.

So whether you are looking for a long-term executive stay, a short-term holiday stay, emergency housing, or a work assignment for a few months, I know I can find the perfect place for you.

I love welcoming my guests to Canada’s beautiful garden city and I look forward to exceeding your expectations!

See you soon,  
- Don Ohlgren

name: Spectacular Views. Nearby beaches. Fireplace
description:
“Cairn”, our rental home, is spacious and serene with the warmth of wood floors and a gorgeous brick fireplace. It is surrounded by spectacular beauty: wildlife, trees, the Pacific Ocean, Olympic mountains and endless sky with countless stars on clear nights.
All seasons have great beauty to experience. From watching winter storms and kite surfers by a roaring fire while enjoying Janis’ homemade scones to enjoying beautiful scenery, walks and hikes all year round.
Available for weekly rental.
neighborhood_overview:
Pastoral, quiet country road that leads to beautiful Gordon's Beach and its spectacular view of the Olympic Mountains.
Some activities near by worth noting:

The Sooke Potholes - wonderful fresh water swimming and hiking- 30 minute drive from our place.

Avatar Grove and Botanical Beach - In Port Renfrew which is one hour west of our home.

Whale watching from Sooke Harbour - 10 min drive.

China Beach- 20 minute drive.

French Beach- 10 min drive.

Some restaurants we enjoy are:

Shirley Delicious- 10 min drive.

Wild Mountain - Wonderful restaurant near Sooke town center- reservations recommended.

Point no Point - great for a lovely water view meal - reservations recommended.

We live 10 minutes west of Sooke, 30 minutes from Langford and one hour from Victoria.
Swartz Bay ferry terminal is about one hour and 20 minutes from our place. We recommend reservations during

host_about:
Like you, I love to travel, including cruising. I love to help people. I love to be hospitable. I love to read, especially about the places I am about to visit in my travels and adventures.  My husband and I have visited most of the European countries, north and south, as well as: Turkey, Israel, Greece. Southeast Asia, and the Western Rockies of the United States and Western Canada. We have also visited the western shores of South America.

"What you know is a function of whom you choose to believe." This is my husband's (Ph.D.) saying. Of course, I believe it.

I just retired after thirty (30) years with one company. Now, I am enjoying sharing our  luxurious vacation resort (which has properties around the world and within the USA). Name any place on this globe, and I will try to help you make your dream vacation or travel experience come true. 

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Thank you,

Lorie

name: The Falls - Gorgeous  2 bedroom 2 bath condo
description: This 2 bedroom 2 bath condo is located in the heart of downtown Victoria,  steps from Empress Hotel, Inner Harbour and Provincial Legislature Building.  Breathtaking city views and spectacular sunsets set the mood for a tranquil and relaxing evening in this modern luxurious setting as well as a pool and workout room for your well being. Air conditioning, fully equipped kitchen, in suite laundry as well as 1 parking spot is part of this beautiful condo.  1 extra parking is available for a fee.
host_about: We have enjoyed our travels throughout the world and our favorite part is meeting locals, learning about other cultures and making friends around the world. We have hosted international students in our own home for the past twenty years who have become part of our extended family.  Victoria is one of our favourite places as it is very relaxing, offers lots of outdoor activities and an array of wonderful restaurants to try.  Our most enjoyable time with the kids is flying kites near the waters off Dallas Road.

name: 2bdm - Condo-Victoria Fisherman's Wharf7
description: Two Bedroom - Queen in master, twins in second bedroom, queen murphy bed in living area. Unit location may be less desirable, may be located near the pool and experience noise and reduced privacy. Maximum occupancy 6. overlooking the bay in a luxurious resort, sleeps 6 people. 5 minute walk to downtown. Fully equipped kitchen with microwave and dishwasher, washer and dryer, gas fireplace, barbecue, cable TV with DVD player, stereo system with CD player, telephone.
host_about:
Like you, I love to travel, including cruising. I love to help people. I love to be hospitable. I love to read, especially about the places I am about to visit in my travels and adventures.  My husband and I have visited most of the European countries, north and south, as well as: Turkey, Israel, Greece. Southeast Asia, and the Western Rockies of the United States and Western Canada. We have also visited the western shores of South America.

"What you know is a function of whom you choose to believe." This is my husband's (Ph.D.) saying. Of course, I believe it.

I just retired after thirty (30) years with one company. Now, I am enjoying sharing our  luxurious vacation resort (which has properties around the world and within the USA). Name any place on this globe, and I will try to help you make your dream vacation or travel experience come true. 

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Thank you,

Lorie

name: 3 Bdrm Suite in Heart of East Sooke on an Acre
description:
A tranquil escape in East Sooke. 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom, self-contained suite with a kitchen and laundry. Pet-friendly, child-friendly and infant-friendly! Large private deck overlooking beautiful cedar and alder trees with a seasonal creek. Enjoy an above ground pool, fenced yard and fire pit.

Close to stunningly beautiful hiking trails and beaches. 25min drive to Sooke or Langford, 45min to downtown Victoria.

Please note, we live upstairs with our friendly dog and 2 young children.
neighborhood_overview: A beautiful, serene neighbourhood amongst the trees near East Sooke Park. Truly a hiker's paradise. We're a 15 minute walk from a trail head into the beautiful, mystical East Sooke Regional Park. We're a 10 minute drive from world reknown, stunning west coast beaches such as Iron Mine Bay, Aylard Farms, and Matheson Lake. All level hikes are available in East Sooke Regional Park. Our neighbourhood features charming homes overlooking the Sooke Basin. Our neighbours are quiet, friendly, avid dog walkers, and overall lovely people.
host_about: Hi we're Julia and Clay Potter. Self-employed home-owners from Victoria, BC Canada.

name: Cozy 2 Bedroom Cabin on Pender
description: Relax with the whole family at this peaceful place to stay.  Beautiful Cabin in a great location on Otter Bay, where you can enjoy ocean and marina views from the sunny deck. It has one bedroom and a second loft bedroom upstairs, with a huge deck and all amenities.  A large hide-a-bed and window daybed are also found in the common area.  There is a shop and cafe down the stairs from the cabin, with a games room and swimming pools (high season only).
neighborhood_overview:
Pender Island offers the relaxation that you look for and activities to keep you entertained. Enjoy the area for great hikes like Mount Norman, hike around one of the local lakes, bike around the island, enjoy many local restaurants and eateries, or golf the local course. Finish it all off with a swim in the pool at the resort (open seasonally).

The cabin is located in a community of other cabins, with guests that are equally excited to be unwinding in a great vacation getaway.

It is a great place to relax and romance, or to have an outdoorsy family getaway on this amazing gulf island.

name: 2BR Downtown Haven near Inner Harbour w/ Parking
description:
Welcome to our elegant 2-bedroom, 2-bath condo, just steps to the Inner Harbour in downtown Victoria! Experience the perfect blend of luxurious hotel amenities and all the comforts of home.
Enjoy floor-to-ceiling windows, in-floor radiant heating, stainless steel appliances & a private outdoor patio, where you can sip your morning coffee while taking in the city views & south exposure.
Park your car in the secure covered parking space while you experience the best of downtown Victoria on foot!
neighborhood_overview:
Our charming Airbnb is centrally located in downtown Victoria and easy walking distance to all the major attractions:

1. Miniature World - View detailed dioramas with historical and fantasy scenes. (4-min walk)

2. Royal BC Museum - Discover BC's history, culture, and nature. (7-min walk)

3. Whale Watching (Prince of Whales Whale & Marine) - See Vancouver Island’s massive marine creatures in action (7-min walk)

4. High Tea at the Empress Hotel - Experience elegance over tea at Victoria's iconic Empress Hotel (8-min walk)

5. Inner Harbour - Watch buskers, enjoy waterfront views, and see Parliament Buildings. (9-min walk)

6. BC Parliament Buildings - Admire architecture, lawns, and the summer light show. (10-min walk)

7. Market Square - One of Victoria's most unique shopping areas, mixed of over 30 retailers consisting of one-of-a-kind boutiques, restaurants, and services (11-min walk)

8. Chinatown - E
host_about:
Hello Superguests!

Thank you for choosing to book with us, we look forward to hosting you!

name: Downtown Victoria, light filled, The Falls!
description: Gorgeous condo {'Relaxing at the Falls'}, 4th floor,  in the Falls: a short walk from both the Inner Harbour & Beacon Hill Park in downtown Victoria.  Close to everything Victoria has to offer!  It is a spacious 1600 square foot light-filled condominium. This is an urban lifestyle gem and you are sure to enjoy this quiet oasis in the middle of the vibrant city of Victoria, British Columbia! WiFi 5G no device limit
neighborhood_overview:
The Falls condo building is nestled within a few minutes’ walk to:
- Shopping including boutique stores
- Victoria Conference Centre
- Arts and entertainment district of Victoria
- The world famous Empress Hotel
- Victoria’s Inner harbour (harbour flights, boat tours, whale watching and cruise ships close by)
- Beacon Hill Park and Petting Goat Zoo
- Fisherman's Wharf and Float Homes
- Sightseeing bus tours
- Museums (including the Royal Museum and IMAX theatre)
- Dozens of restaurants and pubs including fine dining
- Souvenir shops
- Kids activities/entertainment
- The British Columbia legislature buildings
- Bustling coffee shops
- Spas
- Tourist attractions (hiking, biking, kayaking and much more within a short walk or drive)
- Movie theaters
- Exciting nightlife
- Markets and more!
host_about:
I love to travel and over the years have come to realize what comforts I and other guests would enjoy while staying away from home. It is great to stay someplace that feels comfortable, is clean, bright, airy, has all the modern amenities, and that you can just relax in the evenings enjoying a book, watching TV, surfing the internet or watching Netflix on our Smart TV’s (3-55 inch Samsung HD 4K Curved Smart TV's!) and as well simply enjoying the company of the other guests you are with.

I have tried to emulate this in our Oasis at the Falls. If you decide to book our condo we hope you enjoy the Victoria scrapbook of: local restaurants, pubs, attractions, tours to take, shopping close by, hiking areas, parks and many more items. Feel free to add yours in the guest book so that other guests are able to see what other items to do in and around Victoria!

name: A Vibrant Gem in Victoria's Heart!
description:
Indulge in luxury and convenience at our elegant two-bedroom Airbnb, located in the heart of Victoria. Enjoy easy check-in, breathtaking city views, and a premier inner-city pool/hot tub all within walking distance of the city's top attractions. The perfect home base for your Victoria stay. Need to rent a car while you're in Victoria? Book our brand NEW Tesla for 15% off your ENTIRE AIRBNB STAY! Send a message for details.
Garage Parking Height 6ft 7 Inches.

Business License: 00042452
host_about:
I moved to Victoria via Calgary and Prince Edward Island.  I guess being Island  born (Prince Edward Island) explains why I am so drawn to the ocean..... and this ocean doesn't freeze!   My family moved to Calgary for the  booming economy in 2003. Once I finished high school, I moved to Victoria because I love kiteboarding and spent quite a bit of time in Victoria riding my bike for training camps with my team. There are many great cycling routes and paths to explore.  Whether it be the dense forest, vast ocean, rugged mountains, or vibrant city, Victoria offers everything I admire in a place to call my home. I look forward to sharing my knowledge of the city, whether you are returning to Victoria for business or vacation, or coming for the first time.

I also run a Airbnb in Golden, BC! 
My family bought a "cabin" here in 2007, we have enjoyed years of use at this cabin. Now that our family is getting older, we dont use the cabin as much anymore, but we love sharing it with others! It is located 8km south of Golden, in an ideal location for Mountain Biking, XC skiing, Snowmobiling, Para-Gliding and so many other awesome outdoor activities!

name: Rustic Lakefront Cottage In Victoria wPrivate Dock
description:
This very small cottage is located on Prospect Lake.
It has one interior bedroom with a king size bed, as well as a queen pull out couch in the living room.
Under the main level there is a bedroom that is accessed directly from outside. Possibly suitable for adults or older teenagers? More like a glamping set up than indoor space, however there are lights and it is heated.
Near the waters edge there is a gazebo with a hammock in it!

The lake goes right up to the property and is not fenced.

name: Sooke Cove Beachouse
description:
Your private OCEANFRONT beachouse and property awaits. Located in Otter Point, 5km from Sooke Central.

Immerse yourself in nature, the waves are loud, wildlife sightings are many. Gently sloping property with paths down to 3 private pebble beaches and a fire pit area

South facing oceanfront acreage bordered by the Strait of Juan de Fuca and majestic Olympic Mountains. Truly an amazing West Coast experience.

Great location, 4km West of Sooke central, shopping, restaurants.
neighborhood_overview: Sooke's popularity as a scenic tourist destination has existed for generations. Well-known destinations in Sooke, such as Whiffin Spit and Sooke Potholes attract visitors both locally and from around the world. The area's popularity has increased as a base for visiting the wilderness parks of Vancouver Island's southwest coast — the West Coast Trail and Juan de Fuca Marine Trail. Sooke, BC is also famous for its beaches just on the outskirts of its neighbouring communities such as Shirley and Jordan River (Surfing). These beaches include Ella, Sandcut, French beach, Fishboat bay, China beach, Mystic beach and many more.
host_about:
I really enjoy hosting on Airbnb and making sure my guests have an amazing and memorable stay.

I love Sooke and am happy to share my favourite local beaches, hikes, restaurants and breweries.

name: Ocean Grove Retreat
description: Welcome to Ocean Grove Retreat! This main floor 3 bed+den condo has a modern and elegant feel, and is incredibly spacious at 2250 sq ft with a large, outdoor and covered patio perfect spring, summer and fall evenings. Wake up to spectacular morning views of surrounding forested areas and glimpses of the picturesque Esquimalt Lagoon. This beautiful condo is only a short walk to the beach. This private and peaceful oasis is awaiting you and you get the entire condo to yourself. 30-day minimums.
host_about:
Things I like: 
- photography 
- driving
- travel 
- cuisine
- running
- design (interior) 

Favourite travel spot thus far: Paris, Amsterdam, Belgium

My husband and I are big road trip / adventure folks. We plan ahead and try to see as much as possible. We are big history fans, we are very active people, we both Own our own online businesses and have full time careers (Commercial Cleaning & Retirement Communities). name: Rainforest Chalet @ French Beach
description:
This stylish place to stay is perfect for families or couples looking to explore the west coast.

The Chalet is a short walk to the sandy end of French Beach and a luxury wood burning cedar barrel sauna on site.

The Chalet has a chef inspired kitchen with gourmet cookware and is perfect for hosting dinners and family gatherings.

Stay warm by the wood fireplace and enjoy the natural views the stunning 2.66 acre property offers.
neighborhood_overview:
The Juan de Fuca Region is a surfers paradise, a hikers dream, and a book worms fantasy. Idyllic, beautiful, charming and raw, the surroundings invoke drama and serenity all in one.

Jordan River is a 7 minute drive, Sooke is a 20 minute Drive, Port Renfrew is 45 minutes, Victoria 1 hour.
host_about:
I am a young professional with a passion for travelling, surfing, hiking, snowboarding, cycling and all the other great activities that life has to offer.   I like to travel as often as possible and when my career allows.  

I have spent 3 years living in South East Asia, mainly surfing the perfect waves of Indonesia and diving the waters of the Indian Ocean.  I have travelled throughout Europe on numerous occasions and love the way of life.    

When travelling I can do it all. Frequently I camp on the beaches in Mexico exploring remote surf locations and have travelled the world with a backboard and a surfboard.  I also love to stay in style in luxury condos with my wife and baby daughter.

name: Modern 3BR House On Pender w/Peekaboo Ocean Views
description:
Your escape to the gulf island lifestyle, with all the modern conveniences you need.

Surrounded by the island's natural beauty, Juniper is a modern three bedroom house nestled on a half acre lot with peek-a-boo ocean views. Only about a 2 hour ferry ride from Vancouver, it is the perfect mix of a close-enough and far-away getaway.

We are the ideal base to explore everything that this little island has to offer!
host_about:
Pender Island is a very special place to us as we got married here in 2014. We've been coming here the years prior while we were dating, and decided that it was the place for us to tie the knot! We can remember having our first conversation on the ferry ride back after we got married, about how one day, we would love to have a place there that we could bring our future kids to! Now that Juniper is here and ours, it truly is still a bit of a “pinch-us” moment!

We are so excited and grateful to have Juniper as our home away from home where we can create memories with our girls and retreat away from the busy city life that we have! 

We are even more excited to have it as an outlet for my passion of hosting! To be able to share our special place with others, who will also hopefully fall in love with the island as much as we have and also create lasting memories with their loved ones!

name: Spacious 2-BR+Den on Storied Oceanview Herb Farm
description:
Base your next vacation at one of Victoria's treasured gems, Ravenhill Herb Farm, overlooking a stunning inlet of the Pacific Ocean. Located on the Saanich Peninsula with the ocean access in every direction, the farm has quick and easy access to breathtaking hiking trails, parks, beaches, seaside towns, restaurants, grocery stores, biking paths, vineyards and so much more.

You will enjoy the coziness of farm life while viewing beautiful old growth trees, and an array of birds and wildlife.
neighborhood_overview: Located on the side of Mount Newton with its breathtaking hiking trails, the farm overlooks a lush agricultural valley and the Saanich Inlet. You'll also find a roadside hiking/biking path along Mount Newton, and quick access to the beach.
